author: {'steamid': '76561198014388790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1410, 'playtime_at_review': 2562, 'last_played': 1711520522}
review:
Science faction VS (Player) Spy faction = Don't even bother, Sci fact has the upper hand late game. Maybe getting troops into there base early game you might have a chance but then there is no point in unlocking there entire tech tree for there end game tech. Other factions VS, Is doable and feels way more balanced. Also i'll add, The industrial faction have the only late game defence that can go up against each factions late game tech. The rest don't. Industrial faction Nuke's don't count, I'm talking static defence. But good luck going Sci fact vs Spy fact on Hard or brutal lol. Good game though. Recommend for a good challenge. Let me know if you manage to beat on hard or brutal (Late game) I'v tried over 20 times different tactics. no dice. 

Go (AI) Sci fact & (Player) Spy fact. Good luck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004127715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2118, 'last_played': 1710273592}
review:
En ce mois de mars 2024, sur la version 1.0.8, je suis ravi de partager mon tout premier avis sur Steam, et c'est avec une grande joie que je le consacre à Executive Assault 2. En tant qu'adepte passionné de FPS, de RTS, je peux vous dire qu'il est rare de trouver des jeux qui osent véritablement fusionner ces genres.

Pourtant, c'est exactement ce que propose Executive Assault 2. Nous voilà plongés dans un RTS spatial classique, où la construction de base, la récolte de ressources et la construction de flotte. Mais ce qui rend ce jeu si unique, c'est la possibilité de prendre le contrôle de chaque unité en FPS pour participer activement aux batailles. 

Imaginez-vous submergé par l'IA ennemie, retranché dans le dernier bâtiment en vue FPS. Les vaisseaux ennemis bombardent votre base pendant que l'infanterie lance l'assaut. Aux côtés de vos gardes du corps (créé dans la caserne et amélioré via l'arbre de recherche) prêts pour un ultime baroud d'honneur ! Ces instants intenses font de chaque partie une expérience mémorable. De plus, l'immersion est renforcée par une bande-son épique et des effets sonores réalistes qui contribuent grandement à l'immersion !

N'oubliez pas de rejoindre le Discord si vous êtes à la recherche de partenaires de jeu en multijoueur.

À ce jour, je n'ai pas encore trouvé d'équivalent offrant une telle richesse de possibilités et d'innovations. Je vous encourage vivement à plonger dans cette aventure !

author: {'steamid': '76561198138821600', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1710633619}
review:
If you want to play Quake with worse level design then play as a robot.

If you want to play planetary annhilation with a UI from 1991 then play as CEO

This is probably the best concept ive seen for a game in a long time, with maybe the worst execution.

The developer should've just finished the first game, since it was atleast playable, this game isn't.

The first game could be played, and wasn't too bad, though it had issues, was atleast fun with friends, this one is a complete mess, you'd need a lobby of like 40 players before it would even feel like a real game, not to mention the UI would need a complete overhaul, the graphics are fine for what it is, though they seem to be identical to the first game, so im not sure what the point was in a sequel.

This feels very Cashgrabby, i dont reccomend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095964915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 22, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1711312025}
review:
+ True RTS/FPS hybrid experience; Manage an entire fleet or step into the shoes of a single soldier
+ Three diverse factions that cater to different types of playstyles
+ A lot of different technologies; Can take specific techtree branches first to go for strategies
+ Seamless transition from space to ground combat using fighters etc.
+ Executrons can pull off "insurgent operations" by sabotaging / taking over outposts and significantly shift the tides of battle by doing so (even more fun with the spy faction :3)
- Minor bugs, which are excusable given that the game was made by a single person
- Performance is not all that great; totally playable on current systems, though slightly older laptops struggle quite a bit (in my experience)
- Can become repetitive if played the same way over and over again

Honestly, I could go on for a while about this game. There just isn't anything comparable right now that comes as close to the feeling of a hybrid RTS/FPS as this. The pure scale and the ability of a single soldier on a small asteroid to change the entire match by shooting some enemies and pulling some levers makes the player's actions just so much more impactful than in other games. And being able to join a boarding party of a space station assault yourself as the CEO / Executron will never get old.

Obviously, at one point it will get boring to play the same rounds over and over again, but for the price I think it is way worth it, especially if you get a couple of friends together. The developer also frequently updates the game with bug fixes and patches, so there's always a reason to check it out again after some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141077496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1691634247}

author: {'steamid': '76561198181592802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1709440378}
review:
The good:
The gameplay is engaging and it's a great game to wind down to.  The factions are very different in gameplay and you'll quickly find your favourite.  They all have their advantages and disadvantages.
The bad:
The bugs.... ohhh god there are so many bugs!  Some are just minor things like typos or spelling errors but some are game-breaking and you have to work around them to complete tasks.  I still haven't found the special 
 ship weapon for the any of the factions I've played.  With the Science faction, when you try to land one of the link portal thingies for your troops, the probe bounces off into the distance, leaving a trail of your troops just hovering in the air.
Also, there is a massive gap in power between factions.  All of the NPC factions are like annoying insects, to be simply swatted out of the way.  I wish they were more challenging.  You also only get notifications about attacks and such in your home system, so you can be happily doing something in you home system while an enemy faction is happily destroying your stuff in another system.
The verdict:
Even with its faults, I really like this game.  Personally, I think it should have stayed in beta to cook a bit longer but it's compelling and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119458249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1710192103}
review:
The game just isn't quite baked enough in the oven for me to be able to recommend.

It is on the other hand a gem of an idea and has enough potential that I will be keeping an eye on it.

Longer form gripes:

Ui polish is the main issue. Not so much that the visuals are bad, but there is an economy of screen space and some menus are needlessly inflated to take up the entire screen. In a game that's REAL TIME strategy can we maybe take that concept to heart when designing the game UI. I don't need the energy screen to be full screen so I can see some silly pipes and uranium waste graphic. Entire screen has like 5 things you can do. It could be minified/collapsible (maybe and expand option to see all the detail) to not interrupt the game play. That idea spread everywhere. Why do I need an entire screen of dead space for the research menu? Etc etc etc. Instead of being part of the game I felt the menus were jarring to the experience rather than part of the immersion.

The FPS is super flighty. When controlling the ground troops that you don't feel grounded but rather flying a set distance from the ground. Weapon play feels clunky and lacks weight. The visuals are fine, but the distance enemies engage with your lil pee shooter fps makes it feel like a sand box demo. A bit of polish here to just make it "feel" better and less rail shooteresque. Iron sight engagements with weapons that feel  somehow weak and over powered at the same time.

Ships and game play surrounding them is a strength of the game. Some quality of life improvement would be a welcome improvement. Fleet manager and improved organization would lend itself well to the executive vibe imo. Maybe a screen where you display the ctrl groups. toss some fleet names there and a bit of drag drop ui and i'd be pretty happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989217232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1707703805}
review:
Executive Assault 2 is a 7 (GB) gigabyte game.

And as advertised, it’s a real time strategy with space simulation. 
So if you like space colonies, space ships, fighting against other factions, and a little of exploration, then you will enjoy this game.

It can be confusing at first, but thankfully they have tutorials for all the factions/play styles so just go through them and you will know how to get started. 

The really cool feature is that you can take direct control of certain objects like turrets or robots and be right smack in the middle of all the action. Its very fun, but it can be a little slow and clunky after a while. 

The most important here is that you are aware that the whole game is 7 GB, so it should tell you how much new things you can do and discover. But for the right price, I would recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042216927', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1605951767}
review: Executive Assault 2 has been steadily in development for years now, and is one of the few games I'd genuinely argue is worthy of the early access title. For a one man project, this game has scaled immensely and is worth the love and respect its gathered over the years. It won't be for everyone, though it fills a very interesting genre gap by merging RTS and FPS, yet I'd say its well worth supporting this unique endeavor even if it's still under-cooked in a handful of areas.

author: {'steamid': '76561199548878036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1707239199}

review: Honestly a fun game all in all. Scientist faction so far is the easiest for me. But Both space battle and ground battles are great in FPS and RTS mode. FPS mode is slightly lacking in feel but as EA its fine for now. I feel as though there is a slight balance issue but its fun. really cant go wrong with this especially if it grows. Also AI is alittle dumb, it feels like if im not micro managing attacks my ships will not go and attack, even in our home system i have to make them Move towards enemies. ive tried all the settings for guard and defend system but 7/10 times is just does not work. But one of the more fun FPS/RTS games having played Silica and Call of Arms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283538782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1708685737}
review: For a one-man development game it's a blast! Very fun with friends and easy to pick up! Very excited to see where it goes!

review: Fun game, but I feel like its severely unfinished. Needs more research trees, there are so few units and the upgrades all bring your units underpower... meaning you usually cant use those upgrades unless you... I think? Pay crazy amounts of precious $$ for an upgrade unit from the trader that comes once every 30 minutes or so... maybe I'm not completely understanding this game yet but it feels very unpolished and underwhelming as of today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041768250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1706911017}
review:
This game is really fun, yes there is a learning curve as each faction plays differently. Optimisation is needed as my RTX 2060 6GB runs super hot while playing this even with the graphics bumped down.

I've mainly spent time as the CEO though the FPS side runs smooth if a little tedious with the space combat, the lack of gunplay is noticeable but i hope this changes somewhat in the future.
All and all the game is fun and worth the asking price for the RTS side alone.

I've not encountered any game breaking bugs though the unit orders can sometimes be a bit janky when set to patrol or defend system, it will still work but the reaction time is horrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277281561', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1705272236}
review:
this game seems like a game MADE for me, unfortunately in my short time playing it didnt seem to intuitive, i would have loved to do more fps assaults but 3 things stopped me.

first negatives

1) (i have a goood pc) but this game ran quite poorly

2) how to actually deploy into fights didnt make much sense and wasnt really fun (in the ways i could actually find in my short time)

and finally 

3) and this one is the biggest one.... this game doesnt have controller support (for someone who gets pain while gaming on keyboard and mouse) this was very sad to see. i would love to see this game come to xbox or something like that. i dont think id be able to stop playing this game if it just worked on controller

that said i did try to force it to work using steam input but all of the ui and other things such as flying made it a pain to even attempt as the game is clearly KBnM only

now the possitive

this game genuinely seems dope
it does what it says on the tin and would be my dream game 
watching the fights around you is epic though a little jank 
this game has soo much going for it so i do genuinely recommend it to anyone looking for a game like this

sadly it just wasnt compatible with me and my needs

i do hope with alot of support this game can thrive and maybe ...MAYBE one day i could play this on console

review: If you take 20 minutes to actually learn the game, you'll see how many different features from fleet on fleet combat, controlling a ship yourself or running around inside of one of your many different fleet ships, docking cobat with different factions, giant land battles, base defense, all in the scope of building and managing an economy, base and army and being in tune with one of your units. Great game. Especially find it interesting that random players can join and play as one of your units to join the fight if you want them to.

review:

The graphics are excellent
the transition from RTS to FPS and back is seamless, never have to miss any of the action!

author: {'steamid': '76561198197509009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1706170560}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079806306', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1705802348}
review:
Game has insane potential but at the current price I don't think its worth $25, optimization is rough, Executron features are lacking and fps mode needs some love desperately. Some gripes from my personal experience so far is the docking for larger ships as an executron, would be neat to have a feature to just spawn in them or directly control them through the command center screen like the CEO, ground ai are pretty simple but not the worst, flying can be insanely tedious because of the clunkiness or distances. Simply put FPS mode needs some work, RTS mode is pretty solid.


But this is a great concept of a game, co-op works pretty well, ship designs and troop designs look amazing. Plays VERY much like star wars empire at war with an fps aspect. The visual effects are amazing. I bought this only for coop and so far it's been wonders of fun. insanely immersive seeing almost all the ships interiors and being able to freely walk around in them, little niche things like that add a lot to the experience. Seriously an underrated gem of a game and concept, hope to see a lot more from this game in the future!

SIDE NOTE: if you're unsure on purchasing this, executive assault 1 is still a very solid game just minus the crazy space stuff.  great introductory to this genre of game and can be picked up for pretty cheap on sale

author: {'steamid': '76561197969297710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2218, 'last_played': 1710945307}
review:
Ich habe mir ein RTS erhofft, bei dem man seine Einheiten auch direkt steuern kann. Doch bekommen habe ich um einiges mehr:
 - Drei Arten von Firmen, jede mit eigenen Einheiten, Gebäuden und Tech-tree (asymmetrisch, aber balanced).

 - Random Events, durch die man auch Technologien erlangen kann, die nicht zum eigenen Tech-tree gehören oder sogar in keinem der Tech-trees vorkommen.

 - Zusätzlich zu der Möglichkeit Einheiten als CEO aus der RTS-Ansicht heraus direkt zu Kontrollieren auch die Möglichkeit als Executron die Rolle einer art Helden-/Eliteeinheit zu übernehmen und das Spiel allgemein als FPS zu spielen.

 - Ein Mehrspieler-Modus für bis zu 20 Spieler (bis zu 4 CEOs und bis zu 16 Executrons).

 - Spezielle Aufgaben, die nicht von regulären Einheiten erfüllt werden können, so dass Executrons mehr tun können als nur mit den NPC Einheiten in die Schlacht zu ziehen.

Seit dem Release wird das Spiel stetig erweitert und verbessert und auch 2024 wird damit nicht Schluss sein. 
Ich kann das Game nur empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198084486012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1704353666}

author: {'steamid': '76561198164516630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6719, 'last_played': 1709536403}
review:
Overall a grate game, with so much more to come, I was a player of EA1 and now i'm here (well been here) for the second installation; now let me be clear and say that this game is not done. Far from it actually, it has so much potential, from new lines of ships for different factions to mod support for all the wakey ideas modders can come up with. We just have to be a bit more patient, the only few cones I can actively say about the game is its wonky multiplayer base, it works but there can be a few immersion braking bugs and glitches. 

But besides that I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022689116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1709471614}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971184954', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1135, 'last_played': 1704642218}
review:
Executive Assault 2 überzeugt mich mit einer Effektreichen Grafik und eine schöne Verschmelzung von Echtzeitstrategie und First-Person-Action.

Die Besonderheit von Executive Assault 2 liegt in der nahtlosen Integration von RTS- und First-Person-Elementen. Die Möglichkeit, zwischen der strategischen Kontrolle der eigenen Company und dem direkten Eintauchen in actiongeladene Gefechte zu wechseln, macht unendlich viel Spaß und bietet viel Abwechslung in einer Partie. Der Mix aus strategischer Planung und persönlichem Einsatz im Mehrspieler-Coop-Modus sorgt für eine intensive Spielerfahrung.

Das Setting im Weltraum bietet eine eindrucksvolle Kulisse für taktische Entscheidungen und spannende Schlachten. Die Verwaltung der eigenen Company und die aktive Teilnahme an den Geschehnissen verleihen dem Spiel eine besondere Tiefe und Komplexität.

Der Mehrspieler-Coop-Modus ermöglicht es, die Herausforderungen des Spiels gemeinsam mit Freunden zu bewältigen, was den sozialen Aspekt und den Wiederspielwert deutlich steigert. Die gemeinsame Planung und Umsetzung von Strategien bietet zahlreiche Stunden gemeinsamen Spielspaß.

Alles in allem ist Executive Assault 2 eine beeindruckende Leistung im Genre der Echtzeitstrategiespiele. Die Kombination von RTS und First-Person-Elementen sowie der spannende Mehrspieler-Coop-Modus machen es zu einem empfehlenswerten Titel für Fans beider Genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198874549807', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1704163291}
review:
The game is definitely a work in progress but the RTS side is worth it to me. The FPS controls and interactions are clunky and can be quite painful but if you focus on the RTS / CEO side of game play then it is quite enjoyable, I believe some graphic updates, animation and controls / interactions with objects is updated it will improve the FPS side a lot.

Another thing is controlling the ground units while in RTS can be a bit clunky, they don't always do what they are told and if it's a player failure there is no warning or pop up telling you whats wrong.

Overall I think these things could be fixed and I still enjoy the game but it's definitely not for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971465147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1710632763}
review:
A game which is rough around the edges but hits the right spot. It is a moderately slow RTS (Games go from 45mins - 2 hours on average) where careful planning is paramount.

The FPS side of it is a bit janky, but boy does it look amazing staring up at a huge fleet battle from a space station or asteroid surface, and once you know what you are doing, a good Executron (FPS) can win the game for their CEO (Strategy)

It takes a bit to get a handle on the mechanics, but once you have that covered, It plays like Star Wars Empire at War if the ground and air battles happened together and you could take control of any unit at any time.

All I can say, is this game is a special gem that has me keep coming back for more.

Its an absolute blast to play with friends too.

author: {'steamid': '76561199122760667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1708575164}
review:
A hot mess

My number one issue with this is the controls. The controls for this game were an impossible task to change. You couldn't even have control overlap between the FPS and RTS modes despite that they are DIFFERENT MODES, so certain crucial buttons get locked to one mode leading to a jank experience overall at the most basic levels

The FPS side of this is also pretty lacking being the weaker side of the game overall and playing it giving players a negligible impact on the game compared to a CEO.  Playing as an FPS player leads to way too much walking or flying everywhere just to die in 5 seconds because you're as strong as any other grunt.

Most of the positive reviews paint it true, the game has a lot of promise but needs A LOT of work and polish.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970418776', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1703966784}
review:
Executive Assault 2 is a great blend of RTS and FPS, and it really hits the mark for me. As a fan of games with minion management and strategy, this game stands out. The dual gameplay style, combining the strategic planning of RTS with the up-close action of FPS, is a really neat feature.

Controlling minions in this game isn't just a side note; it's central to the experience. It's rewarding to see strategies come to life and to feel directly involved in the action. This game does a great job of making that connection between strategy and action feel seamless and impactful.

Another aspect I really appreciate is the ability to take a step back and watch the battle scenes unfold. The visual elements of the game complement this beautifully, making it not just a game to play, but also one to watch.

This game strikes a great balance. It's a well-executed game for those who appreciate a mix of strategy and direct engagement. In short, I am hooked!

author: {'steamid': '76561198968968014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 605, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1711623843}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999824946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3112, 'last_played': 1707031967}
review:
Thoroughly enjoying this game. so far about 52 hours of gameplay maining as the Industrial faction, havent even touched the other 2 teams yet! The dev has added all kinds of little features into this game that make it pretty interesting and cool. This is probably one of my favourite FPS/RTS games right now. 

Check out some youtube videos if you arent sure. If its your first time and you're a little overwhelmed on how to play you can just create a skirmish match against AI and play as executron in FPS and watch how your AI CEO builds or start a match without any AI in it to learn how to manage your power/economy etc as a CEO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354665338', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1777, 'last_played': 1701059428}
review: As far as I know Executive Assault and Silica are the only 2 game of this style and I absolutely love the first game, but this one is leagues better the only complaint i really have is that if you play with 4 teams the systems can get pretty cramped and the game feels a little small other than that launching a massive drop pod assault against an enemy base while the fleet warps in to provide bombardment support or going on a strike mission to capture an enemy outpost with a couple of transports and the best the ceo can provide is cool as hell

author: {'steamid': '76561198133910117', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1703304692}
review:
10/10 would recommend this game. 

Me and my friend played against a hard AI. It created a huge armada and wiped out his base. He took an escape pod and made it to my home system and now lives as a vagrant in my main base where my robots keep a close eye on him to ensure his... safety.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991747650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1703600800}
review:
El juego es interesante y el que tengas la posibilidad de jugarlo desde varias perspectivas está bastante bien, siendo el control bastante correcto, ahora bien la jugabilidad es un poco rara porque la IA Es del estilo AOE2, es decir, que va a estar dando por saco más de lo que tu puedes gestionar con lo limitada que es la cantidad de naves que puedes construir ya que las defensas aéreas cuentan como nave y eso es una molestia porque no puedes destruirlas, no es que no puedas ganarle a la IA ni mucho menos, pero es muy molesto porque desde el min 0 ya están acosándote y no te permite evolucionar con tranquilidad.
Pero bueno, aun así lo recomiendo porque con todo lo que tiene vale la pena, pero hubiera estado bien que ese sistema de galaxias que se muestra en el trailer fuera real para tener más tiempo para poder desarrollarte sin tener que ir corriendo 😅

author: {'steamid': '76561198093612960', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2489, 'last_played': 1703384202}
review: Executive Assault 2 stands out in the RTS and FPS blend, offering stunning aesthetics and captivating gameplay. While new players might initially find the learning curve challenging, the depth and fun of the game become apparent once its mechanics are mastered. Despite some disproportion in factions' features, it doesn't significantly detract from the overall experience. The action is remarkably well-executed, especially considering the engine used. While facing AI opponents may become less challenging after 40 hours, the PvP and co-op modes more than make up for it with their unique and dynamic situations. Overall, Executive Assault 2 is a distinct and enjoyable experience for genre enthusiasts. I highly recommend giving it a try – it's a worthy addition to any gamer's collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561199094927156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1703031897}
review: Very unique game that takes an interesting spin on the classic RTS or FPS games, but not without its' flaws as with everything. author: {'steamid': '76561197978733024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1701703148}
review:
I bought the game to just play as a executron (IE a FPS guy)
-I had to refund due to extremely low player numbers (searched all servers and found 1 game with 1 person in it. ....) 
-game is full of "jank" like your rifle shooting into to the air during firefights) flying fighters feels like crap. Weapon ranges feel way to low. Physics feels very bad. 
-Ship flying radar/interfaces feels very bad (Elite 3 had a far better space radar) so do games like X3. Controls just feel really bad in FPS.
-Why do i Need a multimeter that only seems to do like 2 things? scan boxes and hack? why not just make that a interact key?

Its a AMAZING idea, but the game right now is the scribbles of that idea on a napkin. I think it needs a different engine that can handle what its trying to be. 

What this game would have to do for me to rebuy it

-Better player numbers in my timezone & time of day ( I can handle everything else but If i cant even PLAY then whats the point) maybe make the game FTP if you just play executrons? or lower cost to play just a executron? I dunno how you solve this. but it NEEDS more players. if this was just fixed I would not have refunded! I need people to play with!

So yeah, I had to refund because I did not want to sit on videogame version of a paperweight. 

But dear god I hope this game gets popular or EA3 is way better and becomes popular.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080053490', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1702543025}
review:
As someone with many RTS games in his library, I have to say I'm impressed. This is a fun-first approach to the genre that required me, a seasoned player of just about every walk of rts, to spend several hours learning each new delightful mechanic this game brings to the table. Definitely a game inspired by rule-of-cool, which is a fantastic guiding principle when creating a game designed first and foremost to be a blast to play.

Switching from third person to first with the simple click of the button is super slick, and even if the fpv game-play isn't your style, its cool as shit to sit in the bridge of your biggest ship and watch a massive space battle play out.

Coming from a one man development team, this exceeds all expectations by miles, and I see myself getting a lot of enjoyment out of it. Get this guy a team! Looking forward to see where things go now that we're post launch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198866249422', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1711972324}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968837081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1700855871}
review:
I appreciate the developer sticking to the original format somewhat but the improvements between this version and the last are in areas that don't bring that much enjoyment. This game really needs better FPS combat and vehicle control and feel, and those are pretty much the same jank as last go-round. I enjoy being the RTS commander a little, but the research tree is worse (you keep unlocking stuff that has other requirements much farther along in the tree, leading to wasted research) and the build order hasn't really improved that much; making interesting base layouts isn't really a thing and you just generally slap things together where ever you make 'em fit. 

Perhaps #3 will get more things right! As it stands, I probably won't play as much of this as I did the first one, since I already have seen what this game's vision is in a more complete product. YMMV but I don't generally recommend this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067753716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1701451440}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039900308', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7378, 'last_played': 1710748367}
review:
Executive assault 2 is an evolution of its predecessor. instead of being completely on land. Executive assault 2 is a space based version of the game with Spaceships and fleet battles being the focus while still retaining the majority of the ground based combat from the previous title. 

The main Focus of the game is Real-time strategy while allowing for individuals to join as automatons who function as individual units in game. This means that it is best played with friends, either going into a PvP between friends, or fighting coop against the AI. 

It is a fun 1-2 hour game to go play with your friends as either a RTS or an FPS player.

review: Very fun, very original. I like the Executron game play very much. That's the mode were you just play a a goon in first person. Taking part in large battles and ground invasions will never get old. You haven't lived until you've been apart of an attack that opens with a nuclear strike on an enemy base. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198048163635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 13110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13109, 'last_played': 1703470084}
review:
Have you ever played an RTS, and wished you could jump in on the action? Do you ever wish that Star Wars Battlefront 3 came to realization, with the ground and space combat in one game? Or, have you played Silica, only to be disappointed that it is mostly eye candy with hardly enough content and terrible AI?

If you can say yes to any of the questions above, then this game is for you!

Executive Assault 2 is an RTS/FPS hybrid, meaning you can either command units in RTS mode, or directly control units on the ground or in space.

There are 3 factions you can play as:
* Industrial: A faction that specializes in heavy armored units, and giant mining ships to take back large amount of resources. This faction uses ballistic type weaponry.
* Science: A faction that is specialized in using shield technology, and has access to sweet mechs. The economy consists of setting up mining outposts that automatically send cargo ships to and from the HQ to deliver resources.
* Spy: This faction is specialized in using stealth tactics to sabotage enemy operations. The Spy faction uses teleportation technology to teleport resources directly to the HQ, as well as teleporting units to anywhere on the map (don't worry, it is very balanced).

Your team is led by a CEO (player or AI) who controls the RTS aspects. There are also Executrons, players who play the FPS aspect on the ground and in space. There is so much content, and details to this game that it might get overwhelming, don't let this discourage you, as there are tutorials and tips. I've bought this game for several friends, and we've all have a blast. Possibly my favorite thing is playing in FPS mode, and seeing the vast scale of some of these massive ships, plus you can even dock a fighter with them, and pilot them!

I can't stress just how criminally underrated this game is. If you are on the edge on whether or not to get EA2, I always say to at least set a timer for 2 hours and if you aren't satisfied, you can always return it before that time passes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971022916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1704769615}
review:
Lots of potential with poor execution. You'd think hosting a server you could set your own squad and bot caps. The interface is dodgy at times and menus will remain up or won't activate at all. The guide is useless and the reference videos are all labeled "OLD". What breaks my immersion is they have THE EXACT SAME ASSETS AND SOUND EFFECTS as Empyrion. Don't know which came first but it's just weird. FPS controls are slow. Piloting ships and operating the turrets isn't very intuitive and often ineffective because the turret will face and fire a random direction from where you're pointing. It's just overall janky.

Saying that... it's a nice time killer with friends if you like to hang out and chat and don't care about super engaging gameplay or challenge. Which is why we should be allowed to edit more than just production speed. We should be allowed to increase or decrease fleet and bot counts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044279296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1701802519}
review:
[h1] Unpolished RTS for short multiplayer skirmishes [/h1]

I completely misjudged this game while buying it. For me it looked like some complex space base-building game akin to IXION, maybe something 4X like Sword of the Stars. This game certainly has such vibes, but ultimately isn't that. It's actually more like simple RTS, designed for short skirmishes - akin to Starcraft.

You have your little galaxy, you build your little base, slap 2-3 updates on your units and just go slay your opponents. It's actually pertty simple, and it's not a genre I usually enjoy - stuff like that is best in PvP with freinds, and I have nobody to play with. So if game would explain me clearlly WHAT it is I would just skip it and call it a day... But it didn't, in fact I spent ludicrous amount of time learning how to play. Part of that is on me because of refusing to read game's lengthy manual, but I still see that as poor design choice.

So, initially I became VERY disappointed with amount of content it has. Then I become annoyed with game's clunky interface. Then I become annoyed with uselessness of most of the stuff (and most stuff IS useless while playing against easier AI).

I consider playing it again, with heavily moderated expectations, but until that time this reviev stays with "thumbs down".

author: {'steamid': '76561198279531788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1650, 'last_played': 1697202840}
review: Необычная игра, соединяющая RTS и FPS (с упором на RTS). Играли целой группой, было весело, хоть иногда и уныло, если играть против ботов. У всех трёх фракций свои технологии вплоть до совсем базовых. Всё очень медленно и оптимизация хромает, как и баланс. Игра разрабатывается уже долго и разработчик (один) до сих пор активно её улучшает. Современных аналогов такой системе как здесь я не знаю. Если есть с кем играть (публичных серверов не так много), рекомендую попробовать

author: {'steamid': '76561198088387133', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1709881755}
review:
Disclaimer: I've only played this game as a CEO, and thus my experience is based off CEO gameplay only.

This game balances RTS and FPS really well. Taking direct control of a unit is worth it in RTS because it makes the unit more efficient, and is fun.
There are three factions, each with different playstyles, strengths and weaknesses, yet well balanced. AI difficulty scales reasonably well, but would recommend playing this against other players/friends more.

There are some bugs here and there, but you can report them through the pause menu.
Overall, a really fun space strategy game that has plenty to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064724127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1802, 'last_played': 1709749417}
review:
Alright strategy game. Needs more units that play supportive roles. Repairing ships is kinda meh rn as it is so slow. Ships become obsolete very quickly and the beginning one is practically useless which is a shame. 

A Ship that repairs is needed (needs to be weak) A Ship that carries a single tank (the first options) would be interesting (could actually make this a special for a current ship). A Ship that allows executrons to spawn inside and produce fighters (not drones) into would be great (should be weak). 

There should be more weapons for short (heavy damage) and long range (light damage) (not counting striker or longbow type units as i would consider them max range imo). What we have now is more mid range. This could actually give the starting ships a use as flanking vessels. Ships should be able to have a better turn point the smaller they are. Maybe even make that into a tech. The Smaller ships also would have some sort of cost and build time reduction as a tech option simply because they fall off so heavily or make the higher tier of upgrades increase their HP more then they do now. 

Fighters are meh, only having one weapon blows when you pilot. Not to mention they cost fleet cap. and instead should be limited in a different way like by 5 to 10 per command post or something which could be increased by the tech tree. They also cost alot (without doing much even in large numbers toward the end of the game and just feed XP to a ship )and should be lowered by like 25 or something. More fighter weapon options like more special options. Also the trade posts and docking bat need to have a way point added so the fighters that are built automatically can go to an area. 

The ability to upgrade each building. Health, add/more drones, etc. Interior and exterior defense upgrades, such as some turrets outside the building that a player of CEO can choose. These for the buildings would have it cost extra power constantly unlike the build able defenses now (the ground defenses need to be like the air defenses in they don't use power or attack unless in red alert).  

The FPS aspect needs more options for clones. Like a medic (maybe even revive), repair, grenades. Executrons need to be able to heal/repair passively when out of combat. Maybe even a new tech tree that they themselves buy upgrades they want (would needs a new resource exclusive to them). They can still you the clone upgrades that the CEO chooses in the tech tree, but they dont have to wait for the CEO to get better gear. What also would be cool is allowing exectrons to build some buildings like a bunker, basic turrets, or repair bay for ground invasions. 

More ground vehicle options. A vehicle that builds clones (like 1 every 5-10 seconds) slowly and allows for executrons to spawn off of, a ground vehicle that spawns fighters slowly and allows executrons to get into a fighter or a light vehicle. A fast moving vehicle that allows flanking maneuvers and an artillery piece. Tanks should be able to shoot their secondary weapon when their primary one is on CD. 

But the FPS aspect is lackluster but i dont expect alot from this. Elevation on maps could help with adding light of sight blockers in a simple way. Also a lock on target option to help players in a fighter track their target. As it is easy to lose your target and have no idea where they are unless you are fighting at a base since you have an idea where up is and some times then it is hard. 

But i do like the RTS game so far. A Production complete notification would help players as well, would help me at least. I do also think a player should be able to choose between a small and a large ship factory, A player can only have 2 to 3 large ship factories and 1 to 2 small ship factories.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977915845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1700329611}
review: This game has a lot of potential with their mixed RTS/FPS gameplay. It feels like they are trying to reboot the game style like battlefront 2, the old one(the good one). It has some empire management and research mechanics like stellaris and the multiplayer potential seems like alot of fun. The part that really makes this game cool is the interesting mechanics for attacking cross system or tranporting troops and landing tanks on the enemy base to infiltrate or siege and kill the enemy ceo to win. I really hope the developers put alot of care and attention to flesh this game out. If you hate slow games or early access bugs and such then I would not recommend buying it yet. I love the sci fi idea's inplemented in the factions, hope to see alot more

author: {'steamid': '76561198087922858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 1930, 'last_played': 1711518034}
review:
Ganz nett.

Leider hat das Spiel Probleme mit CPU-Effizienz. Mein Kühler macht Überstunden. Das Spiel hat eine etwas ungesunde Menge an Spaghetti. Und das Balancing lässt auch viel zu wünschen übrig.

Aber ich finde das Setting und die Fusion von Echtzeitstrategie und Ego-Shooter sehr vielversprechend. Ich bin zuversichtlich, dass die Entwickler die Falten über die Zeit ausbügeln.

Kaufempfehlung, aber mit ein paar Warnungen:

-Hohe CPU-Auslastung wegen Spaghetti-Code
-Wackliges Balancing
(Probleme werden evtl. in der Zukunft gelöst sein.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198255983535', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1700608797}
review:
The real time strategy & first person shooter hybrid genre is something that I discovered recently, and I thought would be a great idea. This has confirmed to me that it is, and if it appeals to you at all, this will be a great first exposure to it. Even as a standalone RTS this game is fully realized with 3 distinct factions and many ship and troop types, all of which you can also command in FPS mode.The first times I went from having an RTS battle into commanding an individual ship or soldier in the middle of the battle were amazing moments for me.

The only big thing missing at the moment is a proper tutorial, which is needed for a game like this, but I've heard the developer might be working on one now. You'll have to do trial and error and rely on the tips provided on the RTS mode for now. 

I highly recommend if this type of game is down your alley. Even if there are a few issues and polish needed, which I will discuss futher below, I want to encourage the solo developer to keep making improvements to the game, and also congratulate them on making a good game! The remaining review will be divided into (1) things I would like to see in the future for this game, (2) things I really liked, and (3) things I don't like or need improvement.


[h3]What I like so far:[/h3]

[*][b]The RTS mode.[/b] The RTS itself poses interesting problems between managing your power and building your bases, researching for technology improvements, finding resources needed to expand your empire, and fighting the other factions. All of your ships and soldiers are upgradable and customizable. 

[*][b]FPS battles.[/b] When the battles in FPS are great, they are great. It can be an incredible experience. 

[*][b]Exploring your base in FPS mode.[/b] I've had a lot of fun exploring a vast base in FPS mode with lots of details and things to do. Seeing a populated base filled with soldiers that I've ordered to patrol, and watching gigantic resource haulers unload their materials and take off again have been novel experiences for me. 

[h3]What needs improvement or doesn't work for me:[/h3]

[*][b]Performance.[/b] The performance of the game could be improved at times, particularly in the FPS mode. I've lowered my quality down quite a bit and I still experience lag even when walking through my base. I realize this is something that is a constant challenge, but improving the FPS experience will be an essential part of taking this game into great territory.

[*][b]Length of matches.[/b] So far, matches can be 1.5-2 hours. While this is not necessarily a negative, as there are many players including myself who like longer matches, it would also be nice if there was a mode for shorter matches ranging from 30-60 mins. Especially for starting players, shorter matches allows more repetitions to learn the game. Starting with more resources, making ships move faster, and starting with more technology could all be possible solutions. 

[*][b]Battle of the CEOs?[/b] The only thing that doesn't do very much for me is the concept of CEOs in business suits fighting each other in space. I realize that this is the central concept of the game, but I feel it doesn't add very much and takes me out a little bit of the space battle experience. It might work better if there were more leader "types" with different benefits to them, like a general, engineer, etc. instead of just a CEO.

[h3]What I would like to see in the future:[/h3]

[*][b]More FPS abilities and skins for the Executor and CEO.[/b] The Executor should have access to better weapons, shields and fighters from the start of the game. So far, there isn't much of a feeling as an executor that you can really influence battles. For one, having bombs on executor starfighters might help this. Killing the enemy CEO doesn't feel as satisfying as it could. To make CEOs harder to kill, they could have access to more weapons, powerful personal bodyguards located in their room, and perhaps a secret escape hatch they can use as a last resort. Both CEO and executor should have more skins to choose from so you don't have to be some guy in a suit or a robot. Also, having a choice between a CEO, general, or engineer as the leader, all with different benefits, would add an interesting element to gameplay.  

[*][b]Jetpacks.[/b] Nothing much more to be said. As an executor, or as a class of troop, having jetpacks on the battlefield would greatly increase the experience. 

[*][b]More aliens, executor missions and larger landing pads.[/b] The feeling of going into a new ship or abandoned facility and having nothing but your flashlight to see was an unexpected but awesome experience within the game. Adding more content to this aspect of the game would be a great investment for the wonder that a player feels when exploring the maps. This might include more difficult aliens or diplomatic missions with the neutral factions to call for a ceasefire. Also, the landing pads might benefit from being bigger and easier to land on. 

[*][b]Alien factions.[/b] Alien factions with completely different gameplay, technologies, and strategies would be at the top of my list if I had to choose. I feel that adding factions would benefit the replayability immensely.   

[*][b]Better experience as executor for troop landings.[/b] So far troop landings have been a bit of a hassel to coordinate as an executor with an AI CEO. So far I've had problems trying to find where the troop ships spawned, troop ships leaving before they have all been created, and problems with follow and land commands for the troop ships. It is potentially one of the coolest aspects of the game if it works correctly, but so far I've had trouble. 

[*][b]More troop and vehicle types.[/b] With the industrial faction, you can make different troop types, but they aren't distinguishable in RTS or FPS mode. Having the ability to command separately regular troops, rocket launchers, and even snipers would be a great addition. Also, having the ability to form troop groups so you can coordinate an assault would be great. Vehicles that are lighter, faster, and able to counter troops or large vehicles would add an interesting component to battles. 

[*][b]Executor adventure mode.[/b] It would be cool to have a stand alone mode where you play as an executor and explore the maps with missions to find cargo or assassinate people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028629173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2884, 'last_played': 1707122232}
review:
The game is a really cool game. It is a mixture between an RTS (for the CEO or commander) and a FPS for the Executron (any team member in the CEOs team).

They share some functions, but mainly the CEO will build and command, meanwhile the executron will try everything to kill other CEOs.

The game is now out of EA... and I'm not quite sure what I should think about it...

PRO
 - The game offers three factions with two different playstyles (Spy and Science/Industry)
 - Each faction feels somehow different, which is pretty good
 - The game has a good AI (but the AI is not overwhelming good)
 - There is a level editor to create own star systems (with single defendable systems, for defenders like me)
 - There bugs, but no game breaking bugs, so it is... okay on that side

CONS
 - There are some issues with save games (settings not loading, etc...)
 - The AI could be better, looks like the AI misses late game stuff or is very late in late game.
 - Some parts of the three factions feel pretty unbalanced (especially the Spys are considered pretty weak)


Should you buy this game?

Well, if you have a friend to play with: Hell, yes.
If you like playing RTS games, but without the whole clicks per minute stuff: Hell, yes! This game is pretty slow in it's own way.
If you like fast RTS action or a really deep economy: No, I guess, this would not be your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128712269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1700243889}
review:
Пришло время изменить обзор.
Итак: плюс-минус разобравшись в игре, должен сказать, что она не безнадежна.

Хромает оптимизация. Враги просто лютые с бесконечным зерграшем в самом начале игры, что знатно так дизморалит, просто потому что ты физически не можешь делать так же, в виду нехватки ресурсов, хотя, может, это я слишком туп. Проблема врагов еще в том, что при выставлении 2-х ИИ, один из них 100% аутсайдер, даже при равном уровне сложности. Как бы я не менял их, один доминирует так или иначе, даже если сделать их абсолютно одинаковыми, в плане вида их роли (индустриальный, научный или шпионский).

На данном этапе 6/10, но уже не плохо. Есть просто ОП тактика - с одним из них заключаешь союз, и готовишься гасить другого; отправляешь десант к "союзнику", отменяешь "дружбу" и выносишь их руководителя, после чего фокусируешься на втором. Тут сильно влияет преимущество по технологиям, но ресурсный голод и зерграшь никуда не деваются

author: {'steamid': '76561197995328576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 37901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2666, 'playtime_at_review': 8277, 'last_played': 1712455326}
review:
This is literally the game I've always dreamed of and this man has literally single handedly made it.  The game can be played as an RTS (executive) or as an FPS/flight sim (executron). You can have up to 4 player executives each with his own team of executrons. Yes there are some broken features, yes there are some bugs and framerate drops while in FPS... but in spite of that OH MY GOD... Literally some of the most fun I have had in any game ever.

Imagine yourself cowering behind a rock with your team as they get picked off one by one from withering gunfire nearly soiling yourself and screaming for help against overwhelming odds when you hear your friend yell over the mic "HOLD ON SON! THE CAVALRY IS COMING!" Imagine looking up to see a fleet of friendly warships crest the horizon as clouds of gunfire and snubfighters spew from the launchbays. Then a salvo of massive breaching pods landing in front of you spewing out tanks, and soldiers as your beleaguered and failed attack becomes an onslaught once more.

I have had so many memories with this game. I cannot tell you the enormous amount of fun I have had playing this game. Would give this the HIGHEST recommendation. I don't think we could ever ask more from any indie developer. I hope he gets the credit he deserves

author: {'steamid': '76561198009740749', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1699322206}
review:
It feels like it has a lot of the same issues as the first one, but just has been slowed down a bit and is a bit convoluted/complex in certain areas now.

I only played a couple games, so i have by no means not experienced everything.

As much as I would love to recommend them game, I just feel like it misses the mark once again.
The addition of missions and what not sounds super cool but it seems like its behind the separation of the executron which is a weird way to separate the game instead of just letting the ceo do everything. 

Units are once again surprisingly lacking in items and customization? and Even more so, now theres 3 factions so the content has been divided between those 3 factions.

---------------------

I just wish I could do 1v1 against my friend and have a cool RTS battle mixed with First Person elements, and it's really close to that. But theres a lack of unit variety and depth to the RTS side, and the FPS side is a little unpolished.

I was hoping this would have been a more refined and polished version of the first one instead theres a bunch of new systems added that has just made a bigger pool of systems that are all diluted.

If they make a 3rd one I'll end up getting that one as well, and will continue to support them, as they are trying to do new cool things, just hope we get a polished/refined product at some point

author: {'steamid': '76561198038447847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10951, 'last_played': 1696789309}
review:
A solid game with a unique approach to multiplayer. 

This is truly 2 games in one. you can either play RTS mode or you can join as an executron doing your best "on the ground" to help out your teams CEO (RTS). If you have that one friend who would rather shoot things in first person then do all that complicated "strategy", then this game is what you are looking for. The 2 of you (or more) can work together to destroy your enemy in a way that i have never seen in any game. 

This adds a new layer for defending also because not only do you need to worry about your enemy units but the little hero's that infiltrate your base in ways that are much harder to predict. Having an execution controlling a ship in the middle of a fleet battle could easily be the determining factor on who comes out on top. Don't get is wrong though. a lone executron can be a nuisance but its only through combined teamwork and strategy that allows a company to prevail. 

Good luck and maybe you might see me at your trade port, sipping on a martini before i fly off with all your "goods".

author: {'steamid': '76561197961412521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1698994516}
review:
Very niche game I love the concept but the implementation is severely lacking in many aspects. 

80's graphics, 90's gameplay, clunky interface(s) and a sever dearth in information on how to play! Even using a search engine it took an hour to discover that there IS in fact a flashlight in the game ... still looking for how to turn it on since I can find no reference in keybinds. 

Honestly I can see why it has a early access price tag despite being "released"! Even at that, the current value of the game to non-fanboi's is about 7 USD if you want to be VERY generous.

 Interesting concept so I hope it gets cleaned up. From what I have seen/heard from people that have been following it since the beginning that is highly doubtful at this time or anywhere in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016739624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2342, 'last_played': 1706970032}
review:
[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
        [*]The CEO role is very fun to play
        [*]Each faction feels distinct from each other
        [*]Each faction's 'Starships' all have different end game methods of becoming strong and scary to deal with
        [*]The fact each faction has its own version of a 'Super Weapon' is quite nice
        [*]The economy of the game is the right amount of simply and yet in depth
        [*]The power management system is a cool idea so you can speed up the rate of one aspect of your base
        [*]The space command outpost are very cool and share some of the uniqueness of their faction's base
        [*]The overall design of the 'Starships' especially is fantastic
        [*]A lot of the research upgrades feel really impactful, but are not brokenly OP
        [*]The Galaxy Editor is rather nice and simple to use for those who wish to use it
        [*]The game has an alright amount of galaxy configurations, that might be randomly generated
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
        [*]The Executron role feels rather lackluster compared to that of the CEO role
        [*]The gunplay is unfortunately not the best and feels really dated
        [*]The flight combat feels low impact and hard to fight manually or as the Executron role
        [*]There is nothing unique or exciting about the Executron role. There really should be some kind of unique vehicles and weapons that can only be researched by the Executrons in order to make using them more interesting
        [*]The fact the Spy faction completely lacks any form of ground vehicle is not a good thing. If you are invaded by any form of tank there is very little you can do about it
        [*]There is definitely power disparity between the difference in power early game with the Science vs Industrial compared to Science and Spy (Science is greater in the early game by quite a bit)
[/list]

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]
The game is really fun to play if you are interested in the RTS elements of this game. If you are looking for a game with strong FPS elements then this game will sadly disappoint. That being said the epic space battles that can occur are quite beautiful and satisfying to watch unfold.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013955014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1698729133}
review: It doesn't feel like it's out of early access. The concept is good, but things like controls for space ships are just bad, the game is in need of better optimization, and there seems to be a lot of parts that just need more polish in general. Got it as a gift from a friend and we had problems playing it together, even to the point that the host dropped mid game due to connection issues and couldn't rejoin as a CEO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002736449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1698544366}
review:
Multiplayer - As Non-CEO

I simply would not recommend this game for its Multiplayer - FPS aspects. 

I played this with a group of 4 - 1 player being our CEO. We learned after the first two games that the controls / access to units for the rest of us were very clunky and manual. The ability to fly the ships and dock into others to independently fly them is a neat concept but awkward in execution, while also feeling like a huge waste of effort and time (its an RTS some things shouldn't take .. a few minutes with a high risk of failure). 

Unfortunately the CEO player has the control to play the game themselves effectively while giving the Non-CEO players less controls and makes them feel rather useless / ineffective to the outcomes.

We all noticed while in the main menu that our GPU usage was 100%. This dropped personally down to 7% simply entering the map editor. 

Overall the game needs more time to cook. Single player CEO appear to have enough to hold itself up as a standalone game mode but unfortunately that is not the reason I decided to try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995215685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1698375502}
review: It's a pretty fun game. Might be better with some friends playing as execs. The entire tech tree looks like a lot but its pretty shallow and horizontal. I feel like when it comes to RTS/FPS hybrids, SIlica, ARMA3, and Natural Selection 2, did it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011332472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2332, 'last_played': 1699053812}
review:
I was going to write a more detailed review but I realised it isn't necessary for Executive Assault 2. This game is exactly what it says it is, it's an RTS that allows you as the CEO (commander) to jump into any unit and control/fight/capture directly or play as an executron (think henchman level unit) for a CEO and play it as an FPS.

EA 2 is a little rough around the edges, but it's foundation is rock solid. The balance is good, there is more than enough content to justify being taken out of early access and it delivers on what it promises.

The only negatives I have are fairly minor and would be what I consider "the polish". 
Stability and performance are acceptable, I have encountered a few minor bugs and the occasional unwarranted FPS drop, but nothing major or off-putting. The UI is a little obtuse as the CEO, and can be downright frustrating as executron. but again it's minor and just needs a tweak and a spit-shine. 
There is a neat mechanic of derelict ships that act as limited time pseudo-dungeons that can be raided for rare tech and other goodies, but once you've seen one you've seen them all. That being said it's still fun and once you get a taste of the sweet loot it offers, you will be hard pressed to ignore them.

I think that would be my biggest complaint about Executive Assault: I want more. Don't misunderstand that, EA2 delivers on what it promises, and with the quantity and quality to justify the price tag many times over. That's the issue though, it promised me a nice dinner and the food was so good I'm now craving a 5 course meal with take-away for later.

review: The mechanics of the game are very well thought out. Namely, the game is a space-themed strategy game. However, there is a transition to FPS mode. You control the ships, tanks, defense units and infantry. You can manage them all solo in FPS mode. I loved this. Besides, let's not forget that the game is still open for development. FPS If the things to do in the mode can be more diversified, the game will be perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013731942', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1698284620}
review:
- Tutorial doesn't tell you much
- AI ain't the smartest
- Ships aren't the easiest to control

But that said, this game is freakin AWESOME! It's akin to Rise & Fall by Midway back in 2006. I love being able to send out a fleet to fight and when they arrive I can take control, or the more interesting part is when it comes to ground assaults. 

The game is far from perfect, it can use some graphics touch-ups, the gunplay could be improved, etc. But it's still a fun freakin time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198379159230', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1698105810}
review: В режиме RTS полный отстой. Просто хотя бы взять ограничение: одна электростанция на астероид. И технологиями не увеличивается. При этом места на астероиде столько, что можно было бы целый город отстроить. Но смысла нет - питать нечем. Да - есть астероид, который даёт сразу энергию. Не топливо, а именно энергию (не спрашивайте как). Но её тупо негде хранить, потому что аккумуляторов тоже нет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141071295', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1711019699}
review:
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3058752276]ゲーム翻訳ガイド[/url]をゲームもツールも含めて初心者ながら公開しましたのでゲームプレイの手助けになれば幸いです。

翻訳作業に夢中でゲーム自体は殆ど出来ていませんので、現状レビューは割愛させて頂きます。
大半の方が気になるであろうマルチプレイヤーについて把握している部分を記載しておきます。
・企業(プレイヤー,AI陣営)は4つまで
・RTS役のCEOは企業ごとに1人まで
・各企業にはCEOが1人と、実働部隊3名の合計4名ずつ参加
・企業間の同盟有り

author: {'steamid': '76561198399312859', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1697977688}
review:
Если тут будет хоть 1 палец вверх, то я буду чувствовать себя офигенно.

Если серьёзно, то игра вполне себе хороша
Тут мы играем за корпорацию, продающую всякую хрень(можно самому прописать что, от наркоты и оружия, до чая липтон). В это же время, нам нужно уничтожить своих конкурентов, которые совсем охренели и думают что могут конкурировать с нами.
+Тут есть разнообразные фракции со своими приколюхами и технологиями. Есть "наземные" бои, Космические бои и Космическо-наземные бои, в которых можно участвовать самому от 3го и 1го лица.
+Есть кастомизация и билды кораблей, для их усиления
+Есть ядерное оружие
+Можно управлять своими кораблями
+Мультиплеер. Ну что была бы за РТСка без ПВП/Коопа. Но тут можно не только играть как отдельные корпорации, но и за отдельных солдат, которые могут летать делать разные задачи(например идти захватить вражескую станцию), что как бы очень прикольно.
+Что-то на подобии дипломатии и торговли. Тут можно делать альянсы с другими корпорациями и вместе идти бить третьего человека. Так же, в качестве заработка денег, раз в 10-15 минут на посадочную площадку прилетает торговец, который скупает произведённые товары, а так же продаёт разные нужные штуки.

+- Графика и анимации. Тут в принципе на вкус и цвет, но стоит не забывать что игру делал(ет) буквально 1 человек, так что ему простительно :)
+- Обучение. Тут оно странное. Есть подсказки которые появляются по ходу игры, но они часто не дают полной нужной информации. Так же, есть расширенный вариант, но там тоже ерунда какая-та, так что лучше самому провести пару игр с ботами на лёгкой сложности(как игра тебе рекомендует в первый раз) и разбираться по ходу игры.

-Оптимизация. И хотя игра может вести себя нормально, ближе к концу матча, фпс проседает до 20-30(хорошо хоть не 10)
-Отсутствие других языков кроме английского. Для некоторых это может быть проблемно(особенно для троечников), но мне нормально.


Как РТС, игра показывает замечательно, а режим ФПС тут как вишенка на торте, позволяющая самому пойти повоевать. 
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970573055', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 2073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1703323744}
review:
Could use a few polish passes for UI, controls and the ability to resize UI for large monitors but the core of the game...It plays like Empire at war managed to get space and ground combat working at the same time and added a sins of a solar empire system map to boot. Matches are usually long affairs but it has a built in system for player loss from server which allows dropped players to automatically rejoin and continue. I have seen big name games like stellaris try this and fail but it works in this game.

Oh and the cherry on the top is the music. Whoever did the score for this game is a master. Its like interdependence day mixed with starship troopers. Hits just right. 

A+/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198092287643', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1697913286}
review:
Играл в первую часть и честно скажу вторая стала красивее, но геймплейно ужасна. 80% космические бои, 15% строительство и только 5% наземного боя. Имхо, если бы бои были на одной поверхности, то думаю было бы динамичнее и большая часть юнитов не простаивала в пустую!
Можете попробовать, но я бы не стал играть в сие творение.
П.С. если добавят мастерскую, то может и спасет ситуацию.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986276633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1697829844}
review:
I bought this for a pair of friends on sale and we had a pretty fun time finding out how broken it was.
I was intrigued to find that it had finally exited Early Access; not expecting much.
...and that's what I got: nothing much.
It still feels quite broken, which is now far less acceptable considering this is a full release. I suppose that just means it's even more abandoned than it was before.
Too bad, too. It was pretty neat being CEO of my own asteroid. Hopefully someone else makes a better version of this since there was truly some unrealized potential, here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026367539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1697839542}
review: The FPS aspect of this game is straight out of 1999-2005, and not in a good way. Horrible textures, zero feedback when doing 'anything.' The game throws you in, and doesn't tell you what to do or 'how' to do anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028959767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1697826069}
review:
This game has no tutorial. If an RTS game ever needed a tutorial, its this one. Absolutely ridiculous expectation to just "figure it out" when its such a confusing a convoluted system.


Edit: This "contextual" tutorial the dev speaks of is literally clippy explaining to you that a ship factory builds ships. It doesn't explain how to design or how each stat works, or even the objective of the game or how to pursue said objective. I'ts very reasonable to expect something as simple as a short playable tutorial to show you the main concepts of this unique game. Or even a YouTube guide for crying out loud.

Let me get one thing straight, I love RTS games and I have thousands of hours playing them as its my favorite genre. This is not a lack of competence or general game design ignorance. This game is not simple, self-explanatory, or user friendly at all. 

That being said, I do love the idea of this game and encourage indie devs to keep pursuing unique and clever ideas on old recipes. I intend to try this game again if/when a tutorial/video is released, but in the meantime I'm not going to spend 3+ hours fucking with it.
developer_response:
Sorry you are finding the game difficult to play.

Just wanted to correct your post as the game has a contextual tutorial which guides you along as you build up your base. the manual which explains how the game works and detailed tool-tips on important information.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354948412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1698442641}
review: Great game, love the battles and explosive effects for space warfare. Haven't played long, but really enjoying it. The spy faction needs a little bit of a buff, and some re-tooling as fake things are still always targeted, but other then that it's been great fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055845063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1697759882}
review:
Play Executive Assault 1. Its Janky but it worked. This one does not accomplish anything I hoped while waiting through its development. Now that it is no longer early access, I bought it, booted it up expecting the same fun as EA 1.

Pros:
Very pretty game visually compared to the first, and first person controls are very similar to the first, which weren't great, but competent enough to engage in combat.

Cons:
The tutorials popups are as annoying as they are uninformative. A few typos here and there as well but I will not take points away from that since they don't impede gameplay at all. Where tutorials did exist, however, they didn't provide insight on key questions.

In a game, several bugs required demolishing of buildings to allow multiplayer friends through doors which would glitch closed.

Eventually while managing power, my base kind of took on a mind of its own and began building random buildings on its own including a second reactor which the game insists I can only have one of.

Power calculates strangely/poorly. After having 3 power remaining, destroyed 1 building, rebuilt it and suddenly have -1 power which was odd.


I would love to like the game, but after waiting so long for the full release I am deeply disappointed. This should not dissuade you from giving the first one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214511684', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1698118134}
