author: {'steamid': '76561197996930491', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1699681382}
review: Overall I have to say this is an excellent FPS/RTS hybrid to play Coop or Vs with your friends. It is quite ambitious and each aspect of the game works pretty well together. Its alot of fun setting up fleets, planetary defences and recruiting an army of clones or bots to do your bidding. For the price I recommend giving this a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044517323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1698868759}
review:
While I think the game has potential in its current state it falls short of all the things it hopes to do. 

The FPS mode is very floaty and feels like a rather bad mid 2000's game on the ground, between janky ADS systems and extremely poor gunplay the ground combat is heavily lacking. Meanwhile in space combat there are a variety of factors that account for a very bad experience such as poor flight controls, horrible enemy ship tracking, region boundaries are not marked and due to how movement/speed works if you go over the boundary for even a moment you can quickly find yourself lost and dead. On top of all of that the camera and UI for both 3rd and 1st person lack so many QoL features and 3rd person flying is damn near pointless. 

The RTS side of things... also needs a lot of improvement. I havent tried it much but will update this section when I feel like playing again but from what I have played it suffers many similar things as the FPS aspect such as poor camera control & UI.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014635150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 2936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2439, 'last_played': 1704360825}
review:
Pros- The game is beautiful and the space combat looks awesome from the ground or air.
+ MP is easy to setup and very stable 
+ You can be a soldier/executron in your friend or an AIs army
+ Fun land and space battles

Cons,
AI can be a bit repetitive, their only strategy is rush rush and rush. One you survive their inital rush the battle is clearly won for you as the AI does not turtle down or steamroll and their base will then be wide open for your counter attack. 
Space combat is wonky at best, no epic dogfights as when when you start to dogfight your likely to go off the map and have your plane blow up.

review:
A few bugs here and there, but as to be expected with an Early Access game. The Developer is very responsive on discord and seems to listen to the player base. They're quick to squash bugs as long as you report them.

The whole RTS/FPS thing is so cool, I'm glad I'm seeing more games with a similar style. This one is unique in it's own way as I haven't seen anything quite like it and I'm sure there is more to come. I'm trying to convince more of my friends to buy this game so if any of y'all see this review, please buy it lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992422669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 12833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12833, 'last_played': 1695729263}
review:
A combination of space and land combat, with the ability to take control of every unit in first person (or third person for capital ships). You can play as either the CEO who controls the RTS aspect (but can also take control of every unit remotely) or as an Executron who is a first person footsoldier or pilot (3rd person when u take control of capital ships).
The objective is to kill the enemy CEO's.

Initally AI difficulty might seem overwhelming, but as you learn it becomes easier. At first I had trouble surviving on Easy, now I can defeat AI even on Brutal difficulty.

Good:
- 3 rather distinct factions with mostly different units, buildings and even 3 different economies (harvesters, mining bases+transports and telemining).
- CEO can take control of all units remotely or even board them personally (which is dangerous though)
- Dev is very responsive: I report 2 bugs and a week later they are fixed along with other bugs I hadn't even noticed.
- Infantry and land vehicle combat and space combat happening on the same map, not many games do this.
- RTS where u can go inside buildings.

Things I'd rather see changed:
- No first person piloting of capital ships. Probably due to visibility, but I'd prefer the option to switch to first person like in fighters
- Tanks cannot rotate turrets 360 degrees in first person, but are limited to about 90 to 120 degrees, probably to avoid getting disoriented. I'd prefer 360 rotation, with an indicator to show turret position relative to the front of the tank.
- No heavy dropships for the Industrial faction. Infantry along with a single small vehicle (that can enter bases) can be moved with the troop (light) dropship. For larger vehicles you have to use a drop pod launcher, which is silly to me and single use, so u cannot pick up tanks again.
- Global resource pool: I'd prefer every station to have it's own resource pool and that u have to use transports to ferry resources between bases/stations. Only Science factions mining bases have localised resource pools and need transports.
- Can only temporary rotate the camera just like Supreme Commander. when u release it, it reverts to default position. Not much of an issue, but still cooler if it were like Homeworld or 
Ground Control 2.
- It'd be nice that when playing as a CEO, you could also take control of a single Executron (especially in single player).

Bad:
- Camera seems a bit hard to control at times. Centering on a specific unit is hard, especially on land units. Camera and UI sometimes feel a bit clumsy compared to other titles.
- Unit path-finding and moving groups is poor. They try to stay in formation/maintain relative distance, even if u select units that are on opposite sides of the map. It would be nice to be able to choose between "formation move" and "All move to same location".
- No formations or formal fleets, only groups.

Conclusion & Hopes for future changes:
-------------------------------------------------------
I has evolved from having only space stations and infantry + small vehicles to having Asteroids (square mini planets/islands) and tanks & mechs. It is cool that u can have spaceships in orbit and drop troops and vehicles on land for combined arms assaults.
The developer seems dedicated to the game. The game could use a few QoL improvements, but it is very much playable and enjoyable in it's current state, imho.

It would be cool if at some point it would have actual spherical planets like Planetary Annihilation, Hazeron Starship and the upcoming Fragile Existance, and if dropships could actually be docked onboard capital ships, e.g. 1 small on frigate sized ships, 2 small or 1 large on destroyer, etc. (a bit similar to how rowboats work in Ultimate Admiral: Age of Sail)
And once we have all of that perhaps someone could make a Star Wars or Halo mod :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198046756136', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1766, 'last_played': 1706601547}
review:
I was a bit disappointed when the dev cut support for the previous game before it reached it's full potential but after playing the sequel for a bit, I see why a change a scenery was needed.

It's good if you used to playing a rough experience but if you want to have a bug free, balanced and less quirky RTS to play, I recommend waiting until it's more complete. Also due to it's small player base, you'll need to either drag a friend into trying it too or attempt to find someone on their discord as I doubt you'll find a match otherwise, it's also much more fun with friends ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561199258451658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1697746573}
review:
Great addition to the FPS/RTS genre! Imagine one of the traditional RTS games like Command & Conquer, but you had the ability to direct control units, and could have players acting as field commanders for your troops... IN SPACE! To win, you don't just fly a fleet to the enemy HQ, but organize a ground assault with stealth, tanks or mechs, depending on your faction choice. It's a lot of fun in the current state and the 3 unique factions bring a good deal of replay value. An exceptional accomplishment for just one developer; and one that's very active! I posted about a dozen bug reports and around half of them were addressed the next day with a patch.

Can't wait to see what future updates bring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031793206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1696291810}
review:
If this game cost more or was made by a larger team, I probably wouldn't recommend it. But the fact that it's made by ONE GUY tempers a lot of the issues I have with it. It's insanely impressive what he's managed to do on his own. 

The biggest issue is the FPS/RTS hybridity (is that a word?). It's an interesting gimmick that typically creates more problems than opportunities. Unit and VFX scaling has to work in both modes, which is borderline impossible in a game that ranges from ground troops to capital ships. Controlling troops in first-person usually isn't helpful either, and controlling ships is straight-up janky. But it's all worth it to be on the ground when your base is getting nuked from orbit, or to stand on the bridge of your flagship as the fleet warps into battle - it looks absolutely amazing. 

There are also a lot of weird little bugs and UI/UX issues - far too many and most too inconsequential to get into here. 

The good stuff is really good, though: Battles look fantastic - ship explosions in particular look better than most triple-A games. Each faction feels incredibly unique with different play styles and aesthetics while remaining relatively balanced. The AI is competent. The unit customization adds a fun wrinkle to army composition. 

This dev deserves support, and this is a worthwhile way to support them. Given the time and resources, I can see the Executive Assault series becoming an RTS classic, but these early entries, regardless of jank, need an audience for that to happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198937797348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 10004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5118, 'last_played': 1710301023}
review:
Do you like Space Combat? Do you like Capitalism? Do you like FPS games? Guess what? YOU CAN DO ALL THREE PLAYING THIS ABSOLUTLEY F*CKING AMAZING GAME!!!!! When I think about space games, I want to be able to experience everything: resource collection, space combat, ground combat, and also the ability to go into first person and walk around your base and experience your empire firsthand.  This game has all of that! Who wouldn't want to play that adventure?

Yes, it's still in beta. Yes, there are bugs. But who cares. Hesketh Studios, an independent developer, has put the time and effort into making a truly unique and incredible game. And they're constantly fixing bugs and pushing out amazing new updates that build upon what is there. If I were to give the team that made this game a single criticism, it'd be the marketting, because to have a game this good with so few people know about it, is crazy!

So in summary. Worth every penny! Buy this game! Play it! Realize how great it is, and please, tell more people about it, because this game is revolutionary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080496710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1700731632}
review:
Я купил первую часть, мне понравилась концепция, я купил вторую часть.. Я ОЧЕНЬ РАД! Игрушка классная! Мне очень понравился подход к игроку, ты игрок без интернета и не хочешь в стратегию? Так иди солдатом, под управлением ИИ Босса! Он тебе и приказы отдаст и подкрепление пошлет! (Да, ты можешь запросить подкрепление через команду)! Возможность садиться в любую технику очень радует! Если вы солдат, то на базах у вас будет возможность садится в истребитель, спутник и десант (не у всех фракций), на истребителе вы можете состыковаться с любым большим кораблём вашей команды, а дальше либо пялимся в окошко на эпичный космический бой, либо сами берём Линкор под управление и бьём врага! Естественно рекомендую играть с как минимум с одним другом! Кооп работает, Играли с другом за одну команду, он был Боссом в режиме стратегии (но он мог в любой момент взять под контроль любого юнита и играть за него). Ощущения очень классные! Пока я занимался разведкой и зачисткой зараженных баз от проксов, мой дружище наращивал экономику и армию! И когда я весь расфигаченный на дымящимся истребителе вылетел после очередного захвата аванпоста, я увидел перед собой новенький Линкор и услышал в наушники, типа давай стыкуйся,  это твой новый корабль) Не зря бил прокса в тёмных коридорах! Дальше рассказывать смысла нет, лучше попробуйте сами! 
Теперь минусы! Есть баги! Играбильно, но могут быть проблемы! (В игре есть возможность сохраняться и автосейвы, это спасает, хотя по моему опыты мы ни разу не загружались и все катки доигрывали до конца без вылетов). Европейский сервер работает лучше Русского! Кто не верит, смотрите пинг! Игра требовательная! Грузиться долго (даже на довольно нормальной машине). В итерфейсе, как и в самой игре, нужно разбираться! Чтобы нажать на монитор и вызвать истребитель в ангаре на базе(и вообще на любой монитор) зажмите кнопку "Виндоус" (Кнопка со значком винды на клавиатуре, между левым альтом и контролом) и потом жмите левой кнопкой мыши на зеленую кнопку, "Лаундж" например. Всем эпичных битв! Игра стоит пятихатки, это точно!

author: {'steamid': '76561199136334496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1710635439}
review: This is a very fun blend of RTS and FPS. whether commanding a fleet in Space and an army on the ground as the CEO or fighting personally with the direct control. then the pure FPS mode with the Executron helping the CEO wherever, like leading their fleets or commanding a squad aboard mysterious ships finding all kinds of goodies while fighting off infesters. author: {'steamid': '76561198799184476', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1693696426}
review:
OK...this game is very good, but has many issues that it needs to fix before i can recommend for the 25 USD it is currently as of this review.
 1.) there needs to be a way to remap all key binds not just a couple.
 2.) the HUD is very poor and could use A LOT of improvements 

My biggest gripe with the game at the moment
3.)  the Executron mechanic. this is such a tedious way to play currently and there's not much that feels like you are helping or really making a huge difference. there's many things that also could be helpful such as quality of life improvements everywhere to lessen this. one thing that bugs me is not being able to use ship ability's while controlling them, you need to ask your CEO to click on you and activate it themselves which i find tiresome. the station combat is a really cool way about it from the executron's pov . One more thing i think would help this alot is maybe adding a personal money system for each executron so that they can buy their own mini fleet or use their cash to upgrade things about themselves only or buy better defenses around the station,place guards,buy fighters,troop transports etc. OK one more thing after that one is let them control units manually that they make or just any from base this lets them be useful and can join front line combat at anytime making the ship battles much more fun and engaging, idk im just shooting ideas currently just feels underwhelming to play as. 

overall a good game with a small team they do good work if you find the concept interesting you'll probably have fun as CEO but as executron its not the best .

author: {'steamid': '76561198023384828', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2973, 'last_played': 1695328007}
review:
For a game made by a single guy, this is amazing.
It blends FPS and RTS, so there is something for everyone. He didnt need to add a FPS mode to it, but he did, and it works. Coordinating your friends as your Executrons, ordering hits and tactical ops from your chair is great.
It's a good buy, and brings to mind older titles like Rise and Fall: Civilisations. 

Don't miss out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043241361', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1686099386}
review: Started off confused, after a bit I was losing but I had figured out the basic's of the RTS mode. I Restarted and started expanding immediately, I realized the map that was generated had an easy unguarded access way straight to the enemy's base and I had just played the starship troopers game so I built a FUCKTON of transport ships and some heavy armored spaceships,played the landing theme from the movie and had the spaceships fly over head the enemy base to attract the orbital defense turrets fire while my 12 transport ships landed and a horde of troops rushed out. I realized that the enemy had giant walkers and all we had were had were our default SMGs. I ordered the troops to charge to the heart of the base, I took control of one of the ground troops and watched as we pushed ahead shooting at the mechs while my fellow clones were disintegrated around me. Finally we were able push through the Mechs and machines and kill the enemy commander at his desk. 10/10 (We've just landed here on what clone troops are calling "Big E" with the 1st invasion Infantry division. It's an ugly asteroid, a Machine asteroid! A asteroid hostile to life as we know it!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198411165625', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 120, 'playtime_at_review': 1116, 'last_played': 1711768441}
review: An absolutely amazing concept but a flawed execution. The game is very fun, while extremely janky, but I do see many people's complaints on how it is highly repetitive with not very much variety in AI tactics to feel like a completely fresh skirmish match. The UI/UX of the game is also flawed, tedious, and aggravating at times to use; the UI feels so clustered at times causing an unimaginative UX. Now one of the main selling points, the FPS/ground control. It is lackluster at best, horrible at worst. Other than using your CEO to walk around your base and watch your beautiful creation, most of the use cases are not there. Why take control of your units when A. you have less control of them and when the actual combat is 2 armies standing and shooting at each other until one army dies. In space its much better, but it still has flaws in the actual flight mechanics. Unit command in this game is also a major con. Whenever you command a group of units to go to a certain place they don't actually go there, what they do is move a certain amount of distance from them to the courser. This can cause units that are far back to not stay with units in front/in the group, creating a mess of controls forcing the player to command small groups or individual units. This is a major issue since by late game you can get massive fleets or armies to that are tedious to command taking your attention away when you could be managing your economy, another battle, building in new space stations or bases. Sadly, without a complete rework of most of game's systems the game will continue to be in a limbo of good but not good enough. Hopefully one day I can boot up the game and play the dream I have wanted for many years.

review:
I really want to see this game in a more finished state! I've owned this game for a while and have been watching the updates. The concept and game play I think are fun but a few things that really bother me about the game (please don't see these as reasons to not try the game at all) the audio is not great right now not in quality but in choice I feel like, there are limitations on how many structures (mainly reactors and corridors bother me), just needs a lot general polish work focused on updating ui elements and especially the AI some more controls would be nice!

Note: Again please try this game I love the macro and micro RTS with FPS game play, raiding your friends base has never been more fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198263779846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1697993024}
review:
Okay I don't typically make reviews for games on steam mainly because I just forget, but I will for this game just because how amazing it actually is.
Now looking at the game you can see that certain things look kinda eh, and yeah I can agree there, but if you can look past that and the sorta still animations for ground troops, this game is actually fun. 
I have spent more time on this game than certain RTS AAA games which is saying a lot because I love strategy games. 
The mixture of RTS and FPS needs to be a more common sub genre. 

The mechanics are pretty engaging, I like how there's a nice amount of freedom when approaching the problems and having a ground/air assault on an enemy base can be really fun if you can really pull it off. With the addition of more units, maybe more factions, different game modes like a ground mode that was in the first game it would be one of my favorite RTS maybe only second to Empire At War.
I hope that in the future this game continues to improve because I really do enjoy it and I recommend if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043327717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1679454513}
review:
As an RTS, it's really good.

The FPS side would need some work. Going solo in FPS feels slow. You need to be at a place to do anything and dying can make for some travel time. Starting your are out gunned and looking for upgrades in stations/ships feels tedious. 

From what I can tell, being in a building can leave you blind to the outside. Which might mean you're working to grind down an outpost while the main base is getting swamped.

Having a Commander that can communicate helps A LOT. They add a ton to visibility just with their overview. A good commander makes a good game. They can help things feel open with less stoppage. Getting help with personal upgrades helps too. 

The game Needs tutorial too. There are some things online, but they can't cover everything.

Overall, it's a good game. If there's an update planned for the FPS side, I could see this having some fun Co-op.
Having a way to upgrades my own stuff through kills or captures rather than relying on the big guy might help. Like a bounty system, so I'm not taking ages to try and find upgrades.


Way-points and Auto travel in FPS would be awesome too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198869110531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2167, 'last_played': 1706548669}
review:
Voici un jeu avec de l'avenir. Un accès anticipé plus que correct 

J'espère voir de nouvelles updates mais je ne me fais pas de problème, des mises à jours régulière avec des très beaux visuels un bon gameplay et une bonne IA. Un RTS qui sort de l'ordinaire qui nous immerge dans le jeu avec la taille des vaisseaux comme le vaisseau minier des industriels, quand on contrôle le CEO le fait de voir les vaisseaux décoller partir dans l'espace, de défendre la base cela n'a pas de prix la sensation est incroyable.

Peux être rajouter :
- l'enregistrement du replay de fin de partie 
- différentes équipes  3 ou 4
- ( une nouvelle race type alien par exemple ) 
- un potentiel de map plus grande selon la volonté des joueurs 

je recommande vivement le jeu j'espère qu'il sera plus connu pour faire des batailles incroyable en multijoueur

author: {'steamid': '76561198005418949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1676825461}
review:
Great premise but it is not nearly there yet. Standing on the bridge of a ship and seeing the fleet blasting away is great, but this alone is not enough to carry the whole game.

While I see that it can make fun with humans (especially PvE), the game itself is very rough. Animations are clunky, menus hard to use and the map/ bases/ ships tedious to traverse. 

Also, while being on the way to battle: 
Hit a frinedly ship after jumping systems (which you can not see before/ control)? Dead. Walk/ fly all the way again. 
Hit the ground/ wall/ ... to hard on the attack run to get into the station? Dead. Again. 

After two times it does not make fun anymore. Plus, (all) the weapons feel as if they are from a pre-2000 game and overall it just seems not finished at all. 
Surprisingly the RTS mode (CEO mode) makes fun and has some meaning (with all the management/ trading/ building/ manageing armies/ ...). As CEO you also can fly ships if you want (without the walking after dying), so I do not even get why the "FPS-only game mode" is even there. 

Sadly I can not recommend the game. Looking at part one I would wait at least some years (like 5) or better for part 3 and save the money (5$ is way more appropriate than ~20$ now). 
I was sitting long time on the fence and have to say: better keep it locked away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963652815', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1965, 'last_played': 1704229906}
review:
Executive Assault 2 is an incredible real-time strategy (RTS) game that combines the best of both worlds: base-building and first-person shooter (FPS) gameplay. As an AI in control of a futuristic corporation, you must build a powerful base, create an army of robotic minions, and strategically battle against rival corporations in a bid for total domination.

One of the best aspects of Executive Assault 2 is the level of depth it offers. The base-building mechanics are intuitive and easy to understand, yet offer a wealth of customization options that allow you to build your base however you want. You can also upgrade your units and defenses to keep up with the increasing difficulty of the game.

The FPS gameplay is also incredibly fun and immersive. You can personally take control of any of your robotic minions and engage in intense battles with enemy forces. The AI is surprisingly challenging, making every battle a thrilling experience that requires careful strategy and quick reflexes.

Graphically, Executive Assault 2 is stunning, with beautiful environments and detailed character models. The sound design is also top-notch, immersing you in the game's futuristic world.

Overall, I highly recommend Executive Assault 2 to anyone looking for a unique and engaging RTS game that combines both base-building and FPS elements. With its deep mechanics, challenging AI, and stunning visuals, this game is a must-play for any fan of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038553449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1703434496}
review:
TLDR: This is probably one of the most fun games I have played in awhile. It still needs work, but in the five years since it has come out, I am really happy to see the amount of growth and love put into this game. I recommend that you all try it, and if you need someone to play with, let me know. I would love to play this game with more people and see it grow. It is that good.

Whether you like FPS or RTS, this game will have something you like. I took a brief look at this years ago and didn't care for what I saw. But now. five years later and ~10 hours in game, I can say I am happy with my purchase. There are three separate factions that each have a different take on how to gain resources, travel, and fight. Industrial CEOs strip-mine asteroids for big chunks of resources, use nuclear power and need to deal with nuclear waste, and make big hulking ships. Science CEOs have lots of cool tech (like their means of transporting troops and ground vehicles, essentially Stargates - or wormholes you can walk through to instantly transport yourself a great distance), but their stuff is more expensive to counter their powerful advantages. Finally, the Spy CEO relies more on subterfuge. They use teleportation technology, and steal resources from their opponents, among other things (watch the newest trailer). I still haven't played them yet, but they seem just as interesting as the Science and Industrial types, so I am very excited to see how they fight.

While some units you produce seem to be carbon copies (e.g., Industrial CEOs get tanks, Science CEOs get walkers, but their UI and control scheme is the same), the weapons and look of the troops between the factions are different. While ground combat still feels a little clunky (I think it is a control issue), it's still fun, manageable, and great to watch a battle line of tanks supported by infantry try to charge your base while you mow them down with a minigun and your clone buddies. Every game starts off in a first-person POV. The mode you selected at the game's start will roughly determine how often you will have to deal with the ground controls (looking at Executrons here), but for an early access game, they suffice for now.

Space combat, however, is where the real fun starts. Taking control of a single star fighter or a large ship is easy to do following the in-game instructions (depending on what mode you are playing, but more on that later). I was stunned by how amazing the visuals were watching ships blow up around me as I led a charge with my capital ship on a kamikaze run into an enemy. Ships have multiple batteries that fire on enemies within range, and when you control the ship, you take over the "main batteries" that are typically the real damage dealers of the ship, while the smaller batteries will continue to auto-acquire targets. Big ships are slow and ponderous, while smaller ones zip ahead. If you run into something bigger than you, chances are it will break your ship, especially if you are moving at speed. And most importantly, when ships lose their remaining health, they explode; not like a "puff," more like how the "Malta" blew up at the start of Halo 2. They go through a series of smaller explosions until they eventually go critical and shatter. Depending on the ship, it even looks different. TLDR: SHIP COMBAT GUD, DU IT!

As I mentioned earlier, there are two "modes" that you can choose between that will really change your game. One has you being the mastermind CEO who has to build, finance, research, and eventually kill their competition. The other has you playing as the CEO's right hand; essentially an officer that can micromanage the troops and fleets produced by the CEO, as well as explore, fight, mine, and recommend attack locations. Of the two "modes" available (CEO or Executron), I think I like the Executron the most. It feels like I am playing a perpetually evolving game of Star Citizen, where the galaxy is slowly being filled with more and more ships. And with how tough the AI is (more on that later), playing a game with 3 other AI, and setting them and your CEO onto "Brutal" difficulty can lead to some amazing battles and situations. Just be prepared for your CEO to die for your first several games while you are off having fun in space lol. Oh, and by the way, transitioning from fighting in space to landing and fighting on the ground - with no loading screens - is a feat unto itself. But mixed with the graphics and music, you really get an amazing experience darting between battleships in a star fighter, or trying to assassinate the enemy CEO by running past their blockades in your execu-ship.

Some caveats:
 
1) The controls are still hard to come to grips with. Even after tinkering with the settings, I was struggling to land shots on the ground because the sensitivity is so high, and I haven't found a way to change it yet. 

2) This game is HARD. The AI will punish you if you are playing as the executive and not constantly micromanging your fleets, troops, and economy - more so than you would in a typical RTS. Couple this with the learning curve of energy, resource management, research, and base layout that you will need to plan out, and this game gets convoluted fast. (But, I honestly think this is a great thing because the developer has clearly put a lot of thought into this game and its mechanics). This will be a work in process that I know the developer is aware of, but I do want to warn anyone who is still with me here because it can be really discouraging, especially if you value your abilities as a micromanager.

3) It's a novel concept: There aren't many games that do anything like this, so it may take some time to get your head around it and for the developer to come up with solutions for the feedback we give. Aside from maybe Conqueror's Blade, I haven't played many games that let you act as an individual and control AI in combat. It can be very hard to take direct control as a CEO, for example, when you really need to manage the RTS elements, but doing say may help your fleet survive a difficult encounter. However, the AI doesn't take over the micromanagement when your CEO assumes direct control, meaning that you will likely lose efficiency by participating in one of the most fun aspects of the game. It is a pleasant challenge, for me, but I would understand if some people feel overwhelmed by it all. I certainly was the first few hours.

I hope those who stuck around to read this found it helpful and interesting, and I hope you try this game and like it. It has come a very long way, and is still making progress in 2023 as of this writing. I'd also like to thank the developer for their hard work on such a cool game. I will be trying to get my friends to play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007756226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 34792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 146, 'playtime_at_review': 7714, 'last_played': 1712445497}
review:
Great game been addicted since playing it. Lots of little easter eggs to explore in FPS and give a different edge to the game. How 1 person playing FPS can really change how the battle flows would recommend to give it a try!

Edit 25/5 - So ive been playing the game now since about December and it has only been getting better. There is an active community on discord which has been great to make new friends. 

The game itself has been getting lots of updates since December, there has been tease of new content coming of new map tools which some have been put already, major balance changes which has greatly improved the game, also tease of a new style asteroid. The developer take on board feed which has been noted in the updates of the game and they are always open to suggest.

Edit 23/11 - Since the launch the game has seeing alot more people now playing the game for matches. Each match is different with the 3 different races its lots of different tec and strategies and can customise your ships with armor/weapon/shields. The sound track is great alongside the game play and very dynamic in the fights. Two games in one with the FPS side and the RTS side. Since playing i found the game develop and more feature are being added and open to new ideas and suggestion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060677903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 11865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2738, 'last_played': 1709622587}
review:
[h1][b]One Man's Vision, Executed Brilliantly[/b][/h1]
[b] You need to play this game. [/b]

This game is one of the most successful marriages of the RTS/FPS experiences.  There's also an arcade space sim included.  Some bughunting too.

[i][u]This is how it works:[/u][/i]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]RTS Mechanic[/th]
        [th]FPS Gameplay[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Base Building and Maintenance[/td]
        [td]Building Repair[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Resource Acquisition[/td]
        [td]Exploration, Looting, and Mining[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Energy Management[/td]
        [td]Adjust power allocation, reset systems, and install new reactors[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Materials Processing[/td]
        [td]Deliver looted resources and technologies to base[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Technology Research[/td]
        [td]Enhance Research Facility efficiency (Can only be done manually)[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Unit Design and Manufacturing[/td]
        [td]Can build and design all the ships and ground units as the CEO[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Fleet and Unit Control[/td]
        [td]Pilot small fighters, capitol ships, ground vehicles, and more.  Command fleets and squads[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Reconnaissance[/td]
        [td]Quantum Travel through jump points to discover resources and reveal enemy activities[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Station Infiltration and Capture[/td]
        [td]Run solo or lead boarding parties of troops and large infantry support units to attack and/or claim outposts.  Sabotage and steal through hacking security panels and disabling vital facilities[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Infestation Control[/td]
        [td]Starship Troopers. Purge infestations from abandoned outposts... or your own facilities[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Base Defense[/td]
        [td]Deploy the station's Red Alert system, control base turrets, defend the CEO[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Base Attack[/td]
        [td]Destroy enemy base defenses and buildings from a ship, or arrive on the ground with heavy vehicles.  Breach the command center and assassinate the enemy CEO.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Free Coffee[/td]
        [td]Free Coffee[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[b]3.1.24 The game is now finished, and I can properly inform you of its completed state.[/b]

The RTS, or "CEO" experience is a well designed machine of beautiful mechanics.  The menus are breeze to navigate, and the UI never gets in the way.  The economy is diverse but simple to manage.  Base building, unit production, and unit command all work efficiently and intuitively.  CEO's can have players enlist as powerful officer robots called [i]Executrons[/i], or players can to join a company as one.  Executron's have the ability to use [u]all[/u] of the CEO's RTS menus via terminals across various buildings.  CEO's can form alliances with others.  The CEO is able to drop down into first-person mode and control any unit or pilot any ship remotely.  The factions each have unique gameplay and design, with awesome captial ships to christen the late-game battlefields.

The ground experience is an arcade squad-control based shooter.  Simple commands allow you to control your unit's behaviors and tactics.  The enemies are not very difficult, and a human player has much better cover skills than the AI.  The FPS gameplay is no hardcore tactical shooter, but it is very useful to your objective and quite cinematic.  Breaching stations with dozens of troops sprinting around you and hacking doors is some quick fun that the CEO can participate in at any time.  The stations and headquarters look beautiful in first-person, and witnessing the busy fleets and living economy moving all around you is an amazing spectacle.  [b]The experience of scale this game offers is insane- the top down RTS "visually automated miniature world" design standard has been shattered by the realization of the entire world from an individual's perspective.[/b]  

And the craziest part: It was all made by a CEO: an human player or AI. 

They are not randomly generated.  They are not a "set piece" of a busy station like most RTS buildings.  They are real and fully interactive facilities with real rooms, terminals, mining ships and cargo barges.  This makes the endgame uniquely fun among RTS, even losing- as you will watch a full fleet destroy your base to the last building and then breach your station to assassinate you right at your desk.  Go out guns blazing in a suit and tie and what remains of your company.

The art direction of this game leaves something to be desired.  There is none.  The environments, architecture, and ground units feel as simple and generic as they could possibly be for their respective factions and roles.  The ships are perhaps the biggest outlier to this, as they are diverse and quite fun to use.  That being said, there is a certain kitsch charm to the game's System Shock-esque hallways and goofy slug aliens.  But seriously, I have played browser-based (shockwave)flash games with better aliens (shoutout to Alien X [2001]).  However, the overall function of the game along with its immersive score should be enough to distract you from this.  It is fun, and it works.  There is ambient space music while building, and epic orchestras while battling.

If you're a Star Citizen player, you owe it to yourself to play this.  Everything I want from a decent session of Star Citizen (which can be rare), I get every match in this game.  I get to go mining, dogfighting, looting, raiding, spooling, docking, etc.  Every match.  If you're not an RTS player, it's okay.  This is pure space fun.

This game is a treat for anyone who enjoys RTS, Battlefield, or space sims akin to Star Citizen.  It's really beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026153422', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1673683514}
review:
Bought the game a while ago. Tried it. Beat the AI even though it was fucking hard. Decided to wait a few months to see where it was. They are now prepping it for release so tried it again.

TLDR: Hard pass.

So of course they buffed the AI while doing nothing to help the player. Basic RTS elements are missing such as rally point hotkeys, right click rally functionality. This gets even worse for the execution which not only has nothing to do (it is not a normal hero and as such cannot defend the base against anything but the most pathetic attacks) but is also super janky on the controls. And apparently fixing this before release was not a priority.

Game is also super high contrast, so much so that it hurts my eyes to watch it, especially in executive mode. It was apparently not a priority to fix either.

There is only ONE way to play each faction. And it is in no way shape or form explained to you you what this way is. As a result the game play is stale and boring. For a game which so many aspects to it you would think there would be some room for creativity but no.

Also the executive shuttle is next to worthless as it has no hp. The AI bum rushes you in the first 15 minutes. Base ground defenses are useless. The bottom line is that there was no balancing fixes at all.

The developer is apparently a single dude. Which is fine but know that this is his second attempt at this. He is long on ideas but falls very short on execution. I don't know how he can test his own game and not notice the eye strain.

Fighter controls make war thunder mouse controls look sophisticated and refined. Also not all objects actually have collision so the AI will randomly fly through rocks in space.

Again the "Execution" can do nothing to defend the base so when the AI t1 frigate rushes you the only thing you can do is hop in a fighter and then spend the next 2 minutes shooting the same frigate in the hop of doing damage. You do not have a bomber or any anti-ship missiles. Seriously a nuclear missile on a fighter is somehow hard to pull off?

As a early access the game had a lot of promising ideas but it is YEARS away from release at this point and most of the mechanics in the game are going to require a complete redesign, say nothing of the balance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026146858', 'num_games_owned': 2768, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1672848979}
review: There are a few games in the same vein as this.  Savage, Nuclear Dawn, Natural Selection 2, Executive Assault 1, and Eximius: Siege the front line.  This is the most promising and the biggest in scope.  The game functions with the scope it has, supports a lot of players, and has a good number of mechanics that make playing an Executron a decent experience to play.  All of that said, I feel as if the executron aspect is still lacking in terms of how fun it is, how much work it takes to actually get into the action. and how quickly you can get knocked out of the action.  I still like the experience but I feel this experience needs to be addressed.  However that is literally the only gripe I have with the game and it has a ridiculous amount of cool assets and mechanics.  I truly feel with some tweaking this could be an unbelievable MP experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007145952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1708931256}
review:
A somewhat Janky but gloriously insane blend of three of my favorite Genres thats more than the sum of it's individual janky parts. It does have a bit of a learning curve, both playing the game and some bug fighting but its not overly unplayable and it only has Skirmish and Multiplayer for now but the latter, in Co-op is how the game is meant to be played

In short, Its an RTS where you can take direct control of nearly any unit (Miners/cargo ships being more or less the exception) as a simple (and with a somewhat but not unplayable level of jank, mostly visual but some gameplay that has workarounds) FPS or Vehicle (Space and ground) sim, where the bases and space stations constructed in the RTS mode double as Mini FPS levels that occur as fleets battle for dominance in the space around it. You'll be boarding space stations, Commanding fleets, managing trade for technology and equipment normally unavailable for your faction and managing your own space station to further your eventual goal of Killing the Other CEO all at once

I have played EA1 and the only real thing it has over EA 2 is the varied strategies you can employ, EA2  relies on how well you mix your combined arms fleet while EA1 you could in theory, turtle, rush, boom, etc with your different facilities. EA2 is way too much of a macro game to do anything but max production and make sure your mix is good enough to deal with the other Guy's mix (where FPS/Vehicle mode is there for micromanaging fleet/station battles), which is fine but I did like starting off the match with a big 'ol cannon! Plus It wouldn't work here for a variety of reasons, not the least that you will mostly be fighting in Space and its split up into a bunch of smaller maps you fight over instead of fighting in one big map.

EA2 however is a better package because unlike EA1 it actually feels like a complete RTS with a bunch of cool extras. You have three factions with some absolutley nutty gimmicks that make up for EA2's relative strategic Inflexibility (Industrial will be strip mining sectors and sending excess nuclear waste to their foes while outmassing EVERYONE, Science has energy shields and Portals, Spy uses Star Trek style Transporters to ambush bases)

In Multiplayer there even is a very cool Asynchronous mechanic where friends can join in as Executrons, basically First person mini-ceo's that manage the base with touchscreen panels or more likely, lead fleets and ground invasions while the CEO has a high level picture of the whole battlefield. The game even spawns shipwrecks to give the Executron more to do in the early game by letting him EVA Star Citizen or X style to grab crates and give the CEO extra resources or tech, and they are pretty much required for the Unknown ship as its more or less an instanced dungeon where you run through kill off a bunch of infestors and loot the place for crates (You can do this as a CEO but you'll have to micromanage that so much you'll lose sight of the bigger picture I find, better to have an Executron handle that while you deal with your foe)

I HIGHLY recommend grabbing a buddy or two to play it this way, its not required but its the best way to play EA2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007421374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2109, 'last_played': 1671803972}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008998119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1685078325}
review:
This is the sort of game I used to dream about playing as a kid in the '90s. Simple RTS married to simple spaceflight sim also married to a simple FPS. 

Make your friends play this game. Sneakiness, economic dominion, scientific might... all of this makes for amazing variety. Looked up from my desk to notice my buddy's Hallway Tanks rumbling toward me.  Freakin' hilarious.  Strong recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069369601', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1670141568}
review: Продолжение Executive Assault, в котором я провёл не один десяток часов, играя с механиками и веселясь с другом. Игру делает, насколько мне до сих пор известно, один человек, чтя традиции первой части. Огромнейший прогресс, в сравнении с первой частью, но, всё таки, игра развивается довольно медленно. Ни в коем случае на данный момент она не заброшена, но сила одного человека - это всего лишь сила одного человека. Разработчик прислушивается к сообществу так, как никто другой и зачастую сам отвечает на вопросы игроков. Сейчас в игре уже трудно найти лобби в мультиплеере, но с ботами сыграть можно всегда. Это - бесконечный ранний доступ, но в отличии от других ранних доступов, этот сделан с душой, вложенной всего лишь одним человеком, и это чувствуется.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058459242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6159, 'last_played': 1695611428}
review:
The first EA was something, but this lifts that already high bar to new levels.

Executive Assault 2 is incredible, still to this day there are moments when I'm playing with my mates and you just have to stop to take it all in.

I'll try not to go to in-depth but the two major points I'd want to make for anyone who's thinking of getting this would be that, the concepts in this game, the mechanics are just... there amazing, I struggle to think of many games where there's like this 'Hybrid' of FPS and RTS all mashed into one with like a original sci-fi blend, It's just really something else in my eyes.

Second thing to note would be that the games got a lot of love I think from the Devs/Dev... honestly I don't even know if there's a team behind this or if it's just one passionate person working on this but either way it's impressive and the games still getting updates and fixes to this day, so to me that's a really positive sign.

All in all it's an amazing game, I've introduced a lot of my friends to this game, ha and spent a small fortune on getting them all copy's cause I've believed in it enough to know they'd like it too, and thankfully they've all been as blown away as I have, games still in early access so as to be expected there are some rough spots, but the people/person behind this game is still here working on it, each time making it even better then it was before. 10/10 would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254198427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3350, 'last_played': 1707008057}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093603022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2222, 'last_played': 1696538469}
review: Executive Assault 2 is the best fps/rts hybrid that I know of. It merges resource management and building with space and ground combat, as you can take over and control troops and spacecraft. It is in early access and I occasionally encounter bugs, but the game is actively being updating, improved, and cared for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027808008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1688511489}
review:
TL;DR: good game, needs continued support to be worthwhile.
This game is very good for those who like its specific combination of genres. It can go from terrestrial FPS shooter to an RTS commanding spacecraft. There are varying playstyles that are supported, and while development is slow, it is constant. Bear also in mind that I believe only one dev is working on this game, and is doing so out of passion and in their free time; it may never reach a 'completed' stage.
One must be willing to overlook various bugs and visual inconsistencies, as well as a lack of a comprehensive tutorial, to enjoy this game. While it does help that the current gameplay system is simple, it makes a lot of content rather ambiguous. If you stick with it enough, you can sample a majority of the content the game can offer in a few hours, and it offers very short individual games, not allowing much for prolonged combat. If any of these are dealbreakers, this game probably isn't for you; if not, I highly reccomend giving this a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073630072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1855, 'last_played': 1701292994}
review:
Some games are developed for years by hundreds of people costing hundreds of millions of dollars and are never finished.

This game has taken years, is being made by one lonely, insane, fuck, and still isn't done. The discrepancy between graphics quality varies wildly from model to model. Most features need incredible fleshing out, and the multiplayer base is all but dead.

That said. This here is one dam fun video game and it's fully playable.

Video games are the biggest entertainment sector globally, bringing in over three bill annually. Now if only the industry could make games instead of a bunch of episodes of video games on an expensive pay per view basis with a shitty finale. 

Rob made this in a cave with a bunch of scraps. His Frankenstein amalgamation of genres plays like how your  inner 12 year old might have dreamed. One second you're sitting in your base, outfitting your meatiest ship with death rays and torpedoes, next you're landing at the enemy's base like D-Day. There's cannons and lasers everywhere. Men and robot soldiers cutting into each other with flame throwers, rifles, and lasguns. Tanks and giant mechs unleashing salvos of siege fire, and incredible fleet engagements overhead raining down godfire upon the hostile fortresses you're assaulting. 

EA2s secret sauce lies in the RTS / FPS combo. While neither a very fleshed out strategy game or shooter, Rob has given his players a ton of stuff to do in between. Every unit is controllable. They can all be upgrade and outfitted to play your way. As a commander, you have incredible flexibility in guiding the war effort system wide. As a dedicated foot soldier, you can apply pressure in specific sectors that can give your faction game winning advantages too time consuming for a CEO to apply themselves to. 

Why this game is particularly notable as of this month, for the first time EA2s playerbase has access to a complete game play experience. From war start, to war end, early game to late, after over four years of early access, Rob is finally able to take this baby to complete game status. While tutorials are hard to come by, the mechanics to play a full game are here, and it feels like it. There's nothing BIG missing it doesn't feel like. Everything I want to do is in here at some level, albiet many begging for expansion upon. If you've been holding off on this game, or have it and have been previously unimpressed, I would endorse this game as currently worth a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056048616', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1695928190}
review:
My short description would be that Executive Assault 2 is Challenging, fun and rough around the edges. It has all the building blocks of an RTS, reminding me a little of Age of Empires and Total Annihilation, but the Executron feature makes an interesting change in how you can approach playing it (with friends).

I don't really play this by myself, but when I get together with my wargame buddies we spend 3 hours on it, one as the commander (playing the RTS) and the others as Executrons, following orders, taking over command outposts, claiming Ancient Energen facilities and looting derelict ships. This game is, to me, what makes videogames fun. You buy the game and get the whole game, no paywall for extra content, no battlepass, no nothing. Then the game presents you with the basic building blocks of a genre with a couple of twists to make it unique and interesting and then you play the game however you want. Sometimes, my friends and I will play it seriously, even turning to military commands and terms to communicate. Other times, we'll asteroid bomb the enemy base, and then escort the CEO to the base so he can personally assassinate the enemy CEO, winning us the game.

The only things I would complain about is how the game doesn't seem to be optimised very well, running at about 20 fps, sometimes dropping to 10, and how it could get repetitive in its current state if played a lot in a short span of time.
These things don't really bother me, as it's a once-in-a-while kinda game for me and the gameplay is fun enough that the FPS doesn't matter (but would be a nice quality of life thing)

Overall I like this game, if you have a couple friends who you like playing RTS, FPS, Wargames or just fuck about with, get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022861871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 421, 'playtime_at_review': 1560, 'last_played': 1712406609}
review:
Gran banda sonora, graficos alucinantes, gestion de recursos muy buena, batallas espaciales muy buenas,  PERO y aqui viene el pero, DIFICIL, muy dificil. LA IA es una bestiada que no te deja jugar. Desarrolla rapidisimamente las naves y envia oleada tras oleada. Hay veces que por mucha flota que tengas y muchas torretas pesadas que poseas en el sistema te da igual, es oleada de 4 naves tras oleada de 4 naves sistemáticamente, no para. Y asi es absolutamente imposible jugar. No te da tiempo a desarrollar. Hay que jugar progresivamente, pero la dificultad es un pelín agobiante. Aparte, la IA de tus unidades es muy ejem, "limitadita" la pones a guardar un jump point y deja pasar a varias unidades, debes estar muy encima .
Cambio mi recomendación a  POSITIVA dado que ha mejorado en parte la dificultad y en very easy o easy se puede jugar un rato.

I have an actual life with limited time to waste trying to learn how to play a game that feels so low budget and rough. I regret buying this and won't bother with it anymore.

review: I have fond memories of the first Executive Assault, despite its flaws, so when I heard a sequel was coming I was excited. This game has come a long way since Executive Assault 1 and its own launch onto early access. Even when this game is finished and no longer receives updates I look forward to this studios next work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198333353046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1698303570}
review:
look its a great game... concept, it used to be more enjoyable before there were factions, then the existing content got split between them and now much has changed other than having more ground units and that your on an asteroid for the most part. its a fun game and better with friends, but as it stands even my high end PC can struggle and heat up when i play because it isn't very well optimized and i haven't seen very many major strides taken to fix it.  The AI is amazing to fight, very hard and fun but with the lack of content there really isn't that much of a game play loop. if the amount of content was tripled for each faction it would be fantastic and provide many re-runs but as it stands i don't see that happening.

i also suspect that the reason why ground combat was brought into the game in force was because the promise to make the first game look just as good and add more to it wasn't ever going to be touched and was promptly abandoned going along the lines of "well we have it here now so don't look over there anymore. that being said id probably recommend the first game more but still.. sooner rather than very much later you've done everything and nothing is left to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127565872', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 39, 'playtime_at_review': 3855, 'last_played': 1711972185}
review:
This is a game I come back to every now and then to fulfill my dreams of controlling a massive fleet of ships attacking the enemy base while playing as a soldier among many on the ground. The amount of times I look up to the sky and see my fleet attacking the enemy fleet while fighting on the ground with my troops against the enemy defenses really brings me goosebumps (added with Star wars soundtrack). I really enjoy this game and will continue to keep an eye out for updates as it gets better and better overtime.

It does have it's flaws but what Early Access game doesn't? The developer deserves high praise for his work (I assume there is only one developer) and recognition. He put out an update, found out he missed out on some bugs, and fixed those bugs within the same hour.

Disclaimer: Many hours I spent in this game was with a friend so I might've enjoyed it more because I was experiencing it with someone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085348033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1705957162}

review:
Is a good game, but it could be awesome... it

+ combines ground and air battles in space providing an amazing experience
+ factions has their trade-off, so nice touch to strategy
- there are few types of foot soldier (and there is no reload or something related with ammo), so that drop a little the bit the tactic
- enemy ground and air tactics are just going straight forward to where you are and kill you, so tactics is not so rich
-  there is no campaign
- there are some bugs (like saving game while you have fighters outside the ship, then you load and you have double quantity of fighters! )

review: Okay when I was younger I watched videos on Executive Assault 1 and I was so intrigued and I wanted it so bad but unfortunately I didn't have a computer at the time so I was excited to play this but I was sorely disappointed I'm sure the Devs are working hard but the Tutorial screen I think is confusing that's my opinion but that's just that start. The "Very Easy" AI it starts you off with did not seem "Very Easy" you want to know why? because within the first 30 minutes of my first game they rushed my ass and spawn camped me not in my own sector but sitting in the next one making it impossible for me to progress because Anytime I tried to leave my sector my craft would get instantly killed because guess what? there were 15-20 BIG ships camping outside my sector. And Don't even get me started on the Promotion "feature" that shit is annoying when you're literally being fucking blockaded by "Very Easy" AI not only did I kill MYSELF 30 BIG ships not even counting the ones the AI killed I NEVER reached the next promotion I think I got just over halfway to the next one which guess what! I had gotten everything in that tech area but I was locked because the promotion is so slow I'm going to stop there but I could keep going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031522042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1663745567}
review:
This game an amazing gem.  Great execution of FPS/RTS combo.  Minor learning curve.

Pro-Tip: Energy resources are controlled via technology and by applying a module(s) in each starbase.  Each energy source is local and thus has to be managed in the energy panel.

I wish this can be expanded (expansions or an updated game w/ more modules and technology).

This game reminds me hints of Sins of a Solar Empire (RTS) and music similar to both SINS & SW.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802046917', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2004, 'last_played': 1636898001}
review:
This game has gotten so much better over time, it's incredible.

It's one of those few early access games that's a fully working product that is more than living up to it's unique premise. It gets updated pretty often, which is incredible considering it's basically one person working on it.

I HIGHLY recommend this. If nothing else, at least to support an early access dev who really deserves it. I hope one day, some popular youtuber or streamer can cover it. Maybe then it'll get the attention it deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104476587', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1651, 'last_played': 1698911832}
review:
Dieses Game ist Tot,
Keine Innovationen seit 3 Jahren mehr,
Kein Progress seit Jahren, sieht man von den 100 Bugfixes und 2 Minor Updates ab.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987101206', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1659755059}
review:
this is one of those games that is unrelenting and challenging to say the least. . . 3 factions each with a hell of a learning curve and a whole ton of stress on top of it all at that.  (For all you people focused on single player games a word of warning, this game DOES NOT PLAY FAIR!!!)  still have yet to beat the easiest AI here and that's a issue i haven't had since the 90's in gaming hate to say this but those old NES and SNES games skill requirement back then were freaking insane (I.E. the original Mario world compared to the newer titles today those old side scroll games never did have an easy mode but that's not whats up for debate here. . .)  back on topic, Executive Assault 2 is a game that a lot of people who are Strategists are gonna respect as well as hate at the same time.  I'm even gonna go on a limb here and say this is more of a Instructional program then a game due to the management aspects alone. . . not even gonna touch the combat aspect yet on the topic, this is a mix between Diplomacy Espionage Warfare AND Research and you cant win on just 1 aspect alone you need to manage EVEN MICROMANAGE to get anywhere in this one!!!  It has a few bugs from time to time and there is no timescale feature here so be ready for a long run.  cause this game is gonna push your strategy making to it's limit and much further.  


(WARNING!!! This game was meant for those who aren't afraid to challenge them selves nor are afraid to lose all the time. . .  This game is not for people who are short tempered or Egotistical.  this game is meant for those who will try no matter what to improve.

review:
Been sitting on this game for a while. Bought it early, as I predicted the dev has been steadily adding content as he said he would. This is a single dev team and like in his previous iteration of the series, has stuck to his goals and plans. 

In it's current state with listed features, still probably not worth the 25 dollar price tag, but it's a fun game and has massive potential if it continues to grow. Pick it up for now if it goes on sale and it will come off as an investment when it's out of EA.

author: {'steamid': '76561199224353772', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2929, 'last_played': 1703780528}
review:
das Spiel kann sehr lustig sein wenn seinen Genger mit 1000 Raumschiffen überrent aber sonst schwitzt man in wettrennen wer schneller und mehr Geld bekommt.Ich finde es sehr schade das für dieses spiel keinen skill braucht sondern es darum geht wer schneller die besten schiffe seiner klasse erforscht.(es sind fast alle schiffe in jeder klasse gleich) bezieungsweise wenn t3 schiffe mit den besten raketen austattet gewint dan trotzdem das überhauptnicht ausgestattetes (ein lvl höher) schiff.Und früher so vor 3 jahren da war das spiel viel besser und man konnte viel mehr machen sogar die mitspieler in einem team also die robotter spieler konten damals selber bauen schiffe steuern,heute können sie das nicht mehr.und jetzt gibt es zu den ultra spam einheiten sogar noch panzer und kampf roboter die total leicht zu bauen sind und trotzdem eine ganze Basis ein reissen können und auch die panzer sind total broke!
Trotzdem ein tolles und spassiges spiel für fortgeschritende strategie liebhaber.(:
Müsst ihr wissen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963736627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3922, 'last_played': 1709216037}
review:
Good fun while playing it, though I would be wary of long play sessions as you leave wondering what you've exactly accomplished with all those hours of gameplay. 

Perhaps the game needs some kind of reward/mission/story/progression system where each game leads somewhere. Something that when you come back to play it later you feel as if you moved onward as compared to the last time.

That being said the factions feel awesome and different, the AI is good, and the fact that you can win the game like a turtle or a hare and still have a chance of winning either way is very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179737775', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1690270710}
review: As broken as it is, I find it strangely fun and extremely challenging. As a slow paced RTS player this game is probably not for me as the AI somehow bum rushes me with like twenty ships due to me being so slow at the game however I find that extremely fun at the same time because it forces me to adapt and evolve from my current play style. I'd recommend this game to any RTS players who are bored of slow time consuming games and play against AI to learn how to play fast paced and precise. It also has three different settings for your company that you can choose from, they really sum up your play style. You can be the industrialization company where you're able to produce mass amounts of resources with huge mining vessels. You can be the science company where you have robots instead of clones and you're ships fire lazers, mining is pretty much automated too. Then you have the spies, where they're ground force is pretty much all cyborgs. I have run into an issue though with the science company where if you mess around with the cargo ships for some reason they dock at the mining station and just, never put the resources back at your space station. Overall, I find this game enjoyable and fun.

review: absolutely fantastic game, i loved the first game and me and my friends played an unhealthy amount of time on it, the new instalment is rough ill give you that but the core gameplay and the RTS/FPS style of the game is what attracts my group, someday id like it to get bigger, e.g ships you build are fleshed out with different compartments like engine room etc so it would be fun to board and capture, all in all hats off the the lone developer who hasnt stopped loving this game from day one and i hope to see them and their friends in a game sometime, keep up the good wor...........actually keep up the AMAZING work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072124283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1651997086}
review:
Throughout the last 30 years of game design, developers have managed to nail together game feel for quite a few genres. 
It takes someone who is more than a good game developer to reinvent the wheel in terms of game feel for a new genre (FPS/RTS). That's why, in my opinion, FPS/RTS games all have terrible game feel.
As you see I refunded the game so this title is no exception to my opinion. 
There are many glaring issues with this title. The clunky almost Empyrion-esque UI / interaction with the game, the terrible gunplay, and very apparent dust trail where the devs are furiously trying to catch up to the features they need to add to make this into a proper game.
Stations cannot have more power added onto them so expansionism is questionably even possible at best. The movement controls are definitely linear in terms of game feel. Multiplayer set-up was also confusing as you couldn't set player count like you would in many other games. It was implied that you were in the game by default and that adding x2 other players would be adding a total of three player slots per game. The economic options are also rather simplistic - which coming off a supreme commander high - is like a drop off a mountain.

Not to be overly optimistic, but this game is not terrible. It's like a rough unpolished lump of metal with both minor and major issues to combat. That said it is by no means a diamond in the rough (to the developer reading this I am sorry for the harsh words). With a very intense labor of love this could be made into something like Zero-K or Empyrion that has replayability and interesting combat. However without polish, gameplay depth, and a complete dive into fixing the game feel: it won't take off the way any of us hope it will. 
There is nothing more annoying than a restaurant critic that cannot cook or a game critic that can't design games on some level so I'm sure this comes across as rather out of line. I'll check back in from time to time, but this needs more work before I can play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352374819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1674458236}
review: The concepts of this game are beyond what ive wanted in a rts but the implementation of the concept needs alot of work. The ships can fit basically lasers and shields with some bought improvements and the research tree is fairly small so it completes in a short time leaving just the fight which for some is good but others want a long marathon style climb up the tech latter. The interface to finding the ships on the systems not galaxy map is challenged an arrow button jumping you from ship to ship would help or something similar. The cargo ship transport lines are very confused and micro managing trade routes if possible is very hard to figure out and the cargo ships have minds of their own which hurts when your money and resources are dependent on them and the specific mats they bring  as science corp anyway. The limit of ships to 100 and droids to 100 is beyond annoying if you want to expand past your home asteroid as if anyone hits any area with a full attack wave of a hundred you cant possibly secure an expanded region when you are limited to a certain amount yourself so your forces will always be outnumbered and the defenses of buildings are not enough either. The ideas of the game are good and if it ever comes together in full vision i think it will be a massively big hit. Still it is a war shooter for those that like that sort of thing but for a marathon rts player we just like alot more. I commend the work the people must have gone through to get the game this far though as its not bad for certain groups of gamers but to be big you have to appeal to a huge group of gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016779262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1169, 'last_played': 1644829357}
review:
일단 뼈대는 좋다. 좋은데 살이 살짝 빈약한 느낌. 물론 얼리억세스여서 앞으로의 행보를 기대된다고 하고 싶은데....... 30분마다 튕겨서 기대된다고 할 수가 없다. 어떻게 패치할 때마다 더 심해지냐?

추가 사항. GOG플랫폼인 갤럭시하고 충돌하는듯. 게임이 크래쉬 될때 갤럭시도 먹통이 되는데 혹시나 하고 갤럭시를 끄고 한 시간 반 넘게 플레이 중. 렉은 여전하지만 크래쉬 되지는 않는다. 

추가 사항. 한 시간 가량 플레이 중에 파폭과 충돌 했다.

추가 사항. 아마 마지막 추가 사항일듯. 아무리 꼼씹어도 이 게임은 많이 부족해.

review: absolutely fantastic game, while its a little undeveloped in some minor areas (as its one dev, who is a legend btw) the core gameplay, concept and systems are nothing short of exquisite. it may take some time to get use to how it works but my god when a massive battle begins its absolute chaos...my only way to describe it is the opening of star wars: revenge of the sith.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073100214', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1697649125}
review:
I'm addicted to this game, from just exploring your own base and the abandoned space stations in first person and looking out the windows into space and seeing the planets. Gorgeous!

Then when you look outside and see a space battle over your base and the bullets and missiles and lasers are raining down as your defenses shoot into the sky in every direction as ships explode! It's like being in a movie. 

Invading enemy bases and fighting your way through the hallways to get the final door before their CEO. Hacking the door as you hear your ships absolutely bombard them suppressing their defenses. The rush! Finally then hacking through their defenses and killing the CEO, it's so satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198852023880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 362, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1712298340}
