author: {'steamid': '76561198026273899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1461, 'last_played': 1641183088}
review:
This game's come a long way since it's first Early Access release. I would highly recommend this, especially if you have friends to play with. While resource intensive, something that has improved since it's first release, it is a fun romp in a galaxy of corporate warfare. Well, solar system but it still counts. Genuinely good game, and the developer works hard with it. 

Pros: 
-Vibrant and colourful art style, with some really cool models.
-The 3 factions currently available are extremely interesting and give a good variety in the game play loop. 
-The trading mechanics are simple and easy to learn, but also give a feeling of varied play. Industrial goods based game-play is a viable option, where the goods can bring in a decent amount of resources for your faction.
-Watching an orbital bombardment on your base is a wonderful thing, and helps alleviate the sting of death.

Cons:
-Resource intensive, seriously it can make modern extremely capable systems sweat at times.
-The new update, that being the Asteroids content release, is still somewhat bare bones for the factions. Research is limited for them, and there are some factions that are just far more useful.
-There are numerous bugs, mostly involving your own AI, but these are mostly annoyances instead of game breaking.
-Trading, while viable, can be hit or miss. A simple mistake can cripple you for long periods of time, and this can certainly happen because of the AI accidentally nuking the trader when they warp in system.
-The ground combat needs more uses other than station and home base raiding, tanks are really only useful in defending and attacking home stations.

All in all, a solid game and one I'd recommend if you want to burn some time in a fun corporate style space game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019820352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1684550252}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960608560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1641298970}
review:
The mechanics are there but the game is in desperate need of polish, or even basic UX design. All of the 2D graphics need an overall, i.e. resource icons, buttons, dialog's and so on. I thought the FPS mode was useless until I needed it to survive a land based attack on my base, and I assume there will be some further enhancements on this in the future to make it more useful. 

That all being said the game has really good depth that takes some time to get use to, not least of all because it lacks any kind of tutorial. The ship combat is satisfying and it harks back to old skool RTS where you need to stack your units but equally they need to be well equipped as the enemy AI is brutal and unforgiving. I keep running into little gems of key tactical knowledge as I move forward in my understanding of the game.

I mirror what other reviewers have said, if you're a serious RTS and space fan, then this game is pretty awesome as long as you can get past the clearly early access nature of the title. Haven't played multiplayer yet but am looking forward to that once I actually beat the AI.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037431120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1640810941}
review:
Fine, I wont return the game as it was on special, its a grand game idea and I like the multifaceted management,

but DAMN, it needs SERIOUS optimization, its not performant at all on an i7 12 core, with 16gb ram and a NVIDIA 1650 4gb GPU ...

Reduce your texture load, investigate how other games like supreme commander / eve valkyrie / star wars squadrons / elite dangerous etc handles high res at various view scales.

Sorry but with a knowledge of how to do this and having played all mentioned games, this game doesnt look as good or perform. The requirements listed should be challenging my PC that plays the latests games on medium at 60fps while streaming, yet this kills the system.

OPTIMIZE Please.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041111928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1696255204}
review:
So I played the last game pretty much religiously. It was fantastic to play, especially with a group of Executrons (though arguably I spent more time trying to protect myself from my friends' morbid curiosity when it came to questions like, "Will a rocket launcher kill my boss?"). 

Now upon playing the new instalment, I'll put it like this: 
There's a small learning curve to it, much like the last one. However this is absolutely no issue. The game is relatively easy to learn and there's a wealth of info provided in-game through the manuals. If anything, the manuals are far better in this game than they were in the previous. 

I would very very very VERY HIGHLY recommend this game if you're interested in strategy games and I especially recommend it to those who want an RTS game with just a little more action. Being able to go to 1st person at any time and control your units is not only fantastic, its revolutionary. To this day I still haven't found any game/franchise that can compete with this. I've only encountered one other game that does this (somewhat) and it was terrible. Executive Assault takes the gold here yet again. Based on that alone, I'd recommend buying it. For those who are interested in getting a little more detail, I will happily provide. 

This game takes the action and destruction from other RTS games, and combines it with some great management skill (nothing to scare of a casual player in case you're put off by this). Plenty of economy management in there, from running your mining operations, to keeping freighters and cargo shuttles protected, to running multiple space stations. This gives you plenty of things to do in-between combat and helps you make the most of every resource you have. Knowing that I need to defend my station so that I can maximise selling "Propane and Propane Accessories" is absolutely joyous. 

Moving on to most people's favourite part, the combat. I'll put this very simply. The combat is very good. The AI has seen some pretty damn fantastic improvements from the last game. Most combat will take place in space via ships, however if you wish to win you'll need to familiarise yourself with ground combat. Unlike the last game, you can now attack/bombard structures from outside. This can do damage like destroying all internal security systems (such as doors and turrets) or in the case of space stations, completely and utterly obliterate the structure. At the end of the day though, you'll need to familiarise yourself with some ground tactics as in order to win the game you'll need to muster up a team and take the fight inside your enemy's base. The CEO will more than likely remain in his office, so its up to you to find him, and blast him back to the dark ages. My friends and I have personally found that the rocket launcher makes for a fantastic CEO-Obliteration-Technique, though if this is unavailable then any old weapon will suffice. The CEO tends to be rather squishy, so if you wish to live long, I would advise you to stay inside and absolutely refuse to touch grass under any circumstances. You're a gamer after all, so this shouldn't be too hard for you. 

My review is already long enough, so to wrap it up, we'll quickly cover unit customisation. Yes. Every unit can be customised to suit any and all needs, except delivery of coffee. To this day I still have not perfected this particular program. Each unit can be equipped with various weapons, armour, gadgets and modules. Each ship can be designed uniquely, and can be given more powerful upgrades as the game progresses. I've personally found that keeping your ships as up to date as possible is a good way to keep yourself alive. You may go bankrupt in the process, but that's ok. Your rivals can't make more money than you if you destroy them first. Build your fleets, create your armies, storm their base and absolutely obliterate their social credit score with some naughty internet searches. 

Overall I give BOTH Executive Assault games an absolutely glowing review. This game deserves more credit than it has been given, and I will stand by this statement until the end of both my natural and unnatural life, as I will be forced to serve our grand CEO as an Executron for eternity. Happiness is temporary. Energen Credits are forever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019475967', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1689533562}
review: Well it is here again. This RTS/FPS blend that a lot of people tried to do and failed. This is not the case for EA2. Game delivers everything it promises. Three factions, each with different approach to energy which is THE most essential thing in the game. Each with its different designs of both land and space units as well as research is different for all of them since they are all using different tech. You can take control of almost every unit at your disposal (from soldiers to biggest ships). So far i have not encountered any bug and everything works like it should. The game lets you start as one of two positions - CEO and Executor. CEO have total control over everything and Executor reduced control to be mostly military leader (have not tried Executor with only AI yet, only played as CEO). So far i have been learning the game and i think i can say that i learned to play as Scientist faction and its great and OP! I also like that game is not only about taking territory, combat and trading. There is a lot of Ancient Space Stations just ready to be plundered of boxes (research or resources) and taken. There is also one huge ship coming from time to time into different systems but i have not got there so far. In the end, yes you can see that game is really in development, there can be little fps drops and little graphic things about models and collisions. BUT. Everything that game offers is really working and the game itself is in really great and stable state even in its version. I have tried and really enjoyed every unit there is for science faction and game itself is really worth full price even now! 7/10 and i think it will be 9/10 maybe even 10/10 because it has the potential to be the best game in its genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147473864', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2327, 'last_played': 1652412276}
review: fun

author: {'steamid': '76561197991018884', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1704153409}
review:
You are going to have to love RTS games for this to be up your alley, as the FPS (on foot) and direct control space fighter + capital class combat isn't really rock solid yet -- but if you are looking for an interesting take on a combat focused RTS, this one has "interesting" in spades. 

This game reminds me a TON of the original BattleZone and BattleZone2 games -- but in space.  

Lots of fun, again, if you are just in it for the RTS aspects of the game.  And the developer is listening to player feedback so if you want to help developing of a unique take on the RTS genre, here is your chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198882320950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1691508314}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012777659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1642785516}
review:
So my last review wasn't entirely fair. I still recommended, overall, but it was based off of some misconceptions and assumptions on my part.

It does need work, It's got a steep learning curve. Less so than X-3 but definitely above average. It does have a manual which stands in for a tutorial but it skips out on some of the minor details that can really cause some annoyance.

I did believe it had some balance issues before and while I still think that is true I do not believe it is to a game breaking degree. Tweaks definitely need to be made but for now it is a little lacking content wise. Does have some replayability factor though because of multiple factions and maps.
 Content wise I'd like to see them increase the map choices, more ships, larger maps, maybe twice the size. Right now 9 sectors/planets are the limit (similar to SoSE in visual lay out), at least 18, in my own opinion should be possible, personally I'd like to see 20, a fun little sandbox to play around in. I'd really like to see more technologies to chose from and maybe more expansion options. Right now player can feel rather hemmed in and the ability to produce reactor cores would be great.

What keeps me coming back, and probably my personal favourite thing about the game is the music. It's very atmospheric and works well to set the mood without being monotonal. Build up and combat feels very different because of this. Build up is somewhat relaxing and when the combat music plays you get a small sense of urgency and the little details feel all the more important.

 So thus far I continue to recommend. Whether or not is stays that way, in the long term, depends on how the game develops from here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060365797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1640791729}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029321347', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1697952225}
review: The RTS aspect isn't nearly as good as most other RTS games, and the FPS aspect isn't nearly as good as most other FPS games, but those games were designed specifically for their genre. This is one of the only games in existence that combines the 2 and the result is honestly pretty impressive, especially when you consider this was made by 1 guy. If you have friends or plan to join public multiplayer games, I'd say the $25 price tag is worth it. If you don't, maybe wait for a sale since the solo experience isn't quite as fun but not bad either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338390304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1702519524}
review:
Amazing graphics and incredible gameplay. You simultaneously have a first person masterpiece in which you can fly around a starsystem shooting enemy ships, or be warped / delivered into hostile bases during takeover operations, and an RTS masterpiece where you command an entire fleet of ships, build your base, and directly control some of your troops for some more precise movements. 

The sheer level of ecstasy you feel upon finishing your assignment, whether it be your 1st or your 100th time finishing, is unrivaled. 

Truly an amazing game. Good work guys, keep it up. I hope to see this game become way more expansive in the future.
Make sure to take breaks though, every time a community overworks its developer, the game always seems to lose 90% of its feeling and charm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011765522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1636864683}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079823508', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1694146792}
review:
Needs some polish. The FPS mode is pretty much just good for checking out the scale of things and it's truly awesome seeing your base at work. I'd really like to see FPS movement given some weight. The ability to walk around with your weapon holstered as CEO (not super important, but still... my immersion haha). ADS would also be preferable to the zoom in on crosshairs we have now. 

On the RTS/Economy side of things... I love it. I'd like to see the economy and interactions with the universe expanded some more, but what's here is quite solid, and enjoyable.

The spaceship combat is arcadey, but fun, and there's actually some benefit to player controlled ships. 

For a $25 indie game, I think it's great. Development has taken some time, but follow the discord for access to the latest betas, and you'll see that it's definitely being worked on... it just takes time, and I think it's worth it to get a 
solid game like this, because if we get an EA3 it's going to be a long long time from now.

If you can look past the Early Access flaws and lack of polish, I'm gonna say it's absolutely worth the money. Just don't go in starry-eyed expecting it to be the perfect FPS/RTS hybrid in its current state.

Oh. One last thing. The gameplay is slow-paced. It's enjoyable to me, but probably good for you to know up front. I spent 3hrs in one match last night alone.

Also... I don't think the game really has a save function yet, so have fun and don't get too attached to your progression.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034368517', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1640389282}
review:
I am Auric Goldfinger. My organisation makes and sells gold bullions in space. I build a big base with many armed guards on patrol. I saw off many boarding attempts and my base destroyed many fleets. I make a tiny fleet with no advanced tech and over harvest minerals in my region, over spend on weak ships. leading to my downfall. But I still found it fun.

In all seriousness it's a fun game that has come a long way. I played 2 years ago and again today. There's been a lot of progress. The space stations used to be feel empty, but now with the decorations and the soldiers on patrol instead of mindless robots standing still it's more alive. There's more to do but as is it's a perfectly playable game. The RTS doesn't always need your attention so you can freely play as a soldier or pilot without worrying about micro management. Overall it's easy to learn, hard to win.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985030131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1701756598}
review:
Super fun game if you're not looking for a full-fledged title with campaign, smooth gameplay, etc. 

This captures the magic of fps + strategy + space sim all rolled in to one. Still needs polish, bug fixes, etc. but this is something that is actually unique and, it seems, a labour of love for the developer. Hope they keep going because this is awesome already.

My biggest issue as of Summer 2021 are the UI elements:
-should be able to see unit groups you select
-should have options for scroll/zoom sensitivity and edge panning
-some issues with issuing orders to groups of units, pathing indicators, etc.
-should able to queue orders (e.g. shift+click move, shift+click mine)
-first person sensitivity way too high, couldn't find an easy adjustor
-should be able to see control groups you assign
-camera is clunky, should be easier to look around your ships in 3rd person and admire the incredible scale of the battles
-could really, really use a higher unit cap
-should be easier to navigate help menu/info menu in game
-with no tutorial it is a bit of a challenge the first couple hours

This game is great, 7.5/10 for me as-is, would love to see some UI and control improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197370861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1626895763}

author: {'steamid': '76561198088041736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1697055638}
review:
[h1] Vorweg , Klare Kaufempfehlung, must try. [/h1]

Eines der besten SyFy RTS die es aktuell gibt.Wer Sins of Solar mag wird dieses hier lieben.
Noch etwas Clunky hier und da, wenig verwunderlich für EA und zudem mit nur einer Person dahinter.
Dennoch erstaunlich bugfrei. Seit mehreren Jahren wird konstant weiterentwickelt.

Grafisch [b] 8/10 [/b]
Gameplay [b] 8/10 [/b]
Zugänglichkeit [b] 6/10 [/b]
Sound Design [b] 7/10 [/b]
Steuerung  [b]9/10 [/b]
[b] Gesamt 8/10 [/b]

Fazit: Gameplay technisch schönes und Umfangreiches RTS, Grafik und Sound-design für ein ein Mann Studio Top. Abstürze noch nie erlebt (in der Aktuellen  Version). Multiplayer und Singleplayer vorhanden.Speicherfunktion vorhanden. 

Am Anfang recht schwierig sich ohne Hilfe einzufinden das Spiel gibt einem nicht wirklich viel Information was passiert oder was man tun muss.Hat man das ersteinmal überwunden hat man hiermit allerdings eines der mit Abstand besten SyFy RTS die derzeit auf dem Markt existieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116017471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1698693790}
review:
I haven't played this game extensively but even after a few hours I can tell it has potential. The core gameplay needs some work, the AI needs improved and it does seem to be missing a lot of elements that I think would really draw people in, but for what it is it's a fun and niche game. A few suggestions on what to add:

-FPS ship combat needs to be a thing. The first thing I wanted to do when I made my capital ships was walk around in first person mode. I could easily see this being an enjoyable FPS option. It doesn't have to be all out like turning capital ships into moving stations, but just adding corridors and security checkpoints to give attackers some obstacles on their way to the bridge would be ideal. This would also be great for the large mining ships, allowing you to hijack it and take the cargo, ransom it, etc. More options are definitely key here I think. 

-The base building is great but needs a few minor QOL improvements I think. More corridors would be awesome, being limited to 5 is very annoying when trying to build a large station that's also visually appealing. And it's an odd number which means you can't do the same thing on both sides of the station :/
Another thing I noticed is the garrison, it has literally no doors at all. I don't understand how it's supposed to be so secure if they can just run right through it even on red alert status. I think it needs blast doors on all sides, that way when the enemy breaches a door they run into a bottleneck and get shot from all angles while they attempt to open another door. This could be expanded past garrisons to corridors as well, maybe making security corridors a thing and slowing down the enemy lemming train to your CEO. This would force players to think more and rely on tactics to breach your defenses. I'm picturing the blast doors on the trade federation ship from star wars the phantom menace while I type this lol. And being able to use and modify outdoor turrets seems like an essential part of station construction that was overlooked for some reason. If people want to just build a fortress and not rely on combat ships they should be given the option, and stronger defensive turrets would make fighting the larger ships of late game more appealing instead of dreading it because you're so caught up in the station building atmosphere. Sometimes I like to just see what I can build and getting attacked by large ships every 30 seconds is really annoying when my turrets are so weak and I have to sit there on red alert for 5 minutes. I think an automatic red alert option for stations would be great as well. I built a station in an asteroid rich system and I don't remember getting a warning that it was being attacked. I just switched over to it and it was gone lol. It would have been nice if it fought back on it's own. This also seems like an oversight because of the FPS aspect, it's hard trying to micromanage stations and fight in first person at the same time. And you can't just put them all on red alert because it harms production. 

-Soldiers/cyborgs need more gear too. I like the research but it needs more options I think. I see in unit creation that soldiers have empty slots at the bottom for things like armor and engine, these could be applied to their relevant units for even more customization. I'm assuming this is already the plan though, for a truly great FPS experience you're gonna need it I think. No one is gonna want to run around with a laser rifle and a weak sidearm for too long, more hi-tech weaponry and equipment is in order I think. This would also be great for the CEO, maybe even giving them a personal force field or advanced body armor or even a powered suit. There could also be a larger variety of soldiers and cyborgs that fill different roles giving you more of a team atmosphere instead of just throwing a bunch of lemmings at them until they die. You could have demolition units that are necessary for breaching blast doors and destroying other objects that may have looked at you wrong lol, heavy assault units acting as a front line, espionage units that can steal information or sabotage things, etc. Or maybe just give them a bunch of different gear options so you can create your own specialized units. But this would be a great improvement for the FPS side of things and even if it's not fantastic I could see it at least being comparable to star wars battlefront or something and that would be sufficient I think. Maybe you could act as a squad leader and get AI units to follow you so you could team up with another CEO with their team and accomplish 2 tasks at once. Just various things like that I feel would add more fun dynamics to the game and bring in more players. 

That being said, I like the game and I would definitely recommend it. It's not polished, it has some flaws, but it has potential and there are so many things that could be added in the future. Solid 7/10 for me, keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048299402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10580, 'last_played': 1707809674}
review:
A hybrid FPS-RTS game that satisfies a very niche market. This game honestly though is some of the best fun that I've had in a while. You can play against AI if you wish, or jump into online multiplayer and play with or against other people. The game is constantly being updated, and communication with the developer is fluid. Bugs are identified and addressed as soon as possible. I bought this game at release, the amount of new content between now and that point is staggering.

A definite recommendation from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121773829', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2758, 'last_played': 1698011046}
review:
It's weird, it's kinda broken, and it needs plenty of work. But holy crap does it have scale! Just the fact that you can build these giant bases and ships and then just walk around them even while they're attacking stuff is amazing at times. It's also a pretty solid RTS at the base level, if a little slow.
The game's hardly perfect, but in terms of what it provides it's second to none as far as I can tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115543225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1675599169}
review:
일단 재밌습니다. 내가 만든 비행기나 건물을 누비며 다닐수 있다는게 정말 아기자기하고 기분이 좋았습니다. 

다만 아쉬웠던건 업그레이드랑 발전연료를 만들수 없고 사기만 한다는게 너무 아쉬웠네요. 업글에 발전연료를 만들수 있는걸 넣어주거나 아니면 상온핵융합같이 한번 켜지면 계속 발전되는 형태로 하는 업글해줬으면 좋았을거 같습니다. 동시에 발전량을 늘려서 전기좀 많이 나오게 해줘도 좋구요. 그외 엔진 업글이나 아머업글같은것도 없어서 아쉬웠습니다. 원래 이런게 있어야 하는데 없는거 보면 미완성으로 게임을 내놓은게 아닌가 하는 생각이 강하게 드네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020095364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 62, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1712373950}
review:
Overall a good idea but sadly as others have said, very unpolished. Considering i have now waited over a year between plays not much has changed and i feel this will basically be the end state of the game. Expensive for what it is, but still has a lot of potential if they decide to continue working on it. 

Also, not sure about anyone else but i felt the FPS mode went mostly untouched as it didnt really add benefit.
developer_response:
Hello, sorry to hear you are feeling unsatisfied with development, believe me its being worked on constantly with a new patch out a few days ago which added loads of new features with the help of the Discord group with plenty more content on the way as well as bug fixes.

FPS mode adds the benefit of being down there with your troops or spaceships with various buffs and great fun in multiplayer too.

Happy gaming!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037357715', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1651858840}
review:
Ight, this will be a fast and honest review.

The game is definitely a game. Its been in Early Access now for almost three years, and to be completely fair its not really gone very far in terms of content but its come a long ways from where it started. The language was insanely rough in the early days, interface was buggy as all hell and honestly I felt pretty jaded by the game at first. Three years later it still has Big big still cooking energy, but like a fantastic all American apple it's stinking up the house in all the right ways. Once more intense content is added and maybe we see a workshop inclusion this will be the game to look out for.  

That said its kind of like a rock polisher. Its slow and taking some serious time to get where its going but I'll be damned if it ain't still going. Executive Assault 2 is the Little Engine that will of the indie RTS scene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136781537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1709531523}
review: This game is pretty fun. I like watching my fleet engage the enemy from the bridge. The FPS part is a little wonky to me but isn't too bad. Mainly flying fighters is clumsy to me and the guns aren't very accurate but that might be because I suck. The fps/rts hybrid is very cool and I wish more games would offer direct control whether it be first person or third person action. I've been waiting for a game like this set in medieval or ancient times. Maybe that could be the next project for this developer? I would definitely buy that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073626474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1695483937}
review: if you like having constant disconnection during multiplayer games with your mate, this game is for you. released back in 2018, and yeah i get it, early release and all that jazz, but come on... if it was a bit more playable it would be great. however the way it is now, it is un-balanced, un-explained, and if you want a nice decent match, and are on it for more then an hour, un-playable. haven't even finished a match to this date without saving and exiting, followed by rinse and repeat multiple times over. then the game glitches out, you get pissed at it, then close it done. cheers for all the frustration simply because if won't bloody work

review:
REALLY NEAT concept of a game, with a tiny development team (I think just one guy so go easy on him). Updates are slow and steady, and bugs are slowly being ironed out with each iteration being more playable then the last. 
Looks great, sounds great, UI is improving - and I love the choice to either control the strategy, or determine the tactics in FPS mode.

review: This is the perfect mix between an FPS and a Strategy game set in space. I played through the tutorial and one custom game (got gobsmacked playing on Brutal). The dev has a great sense of humor and there are easter eggs that you can easily miss if you aren't paying attention. I can only imagine how amazing this game will be once they finish. There's a few things that make you remember it's early access but for the majority of the time, it feels like a finished game. Thanks to the dev for all their hard work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060440256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1676688380}
review:
Note:  This Review was from January 2021.  The game has undergone a lot of development since then, and this review likely does not reflect the current state of the game.

tl;dr: This game is severely unpolished and lacking an engaging core gameplay loop.  [b]It's a tech demo at best[/b], and can't be justified for its current price.
Recommended purchase price if on sale: $5-$10
[hr][/hr]

[h1]Major Cons:[/h1]
- [b]Severely limited replayability[/b] in singleplayer/coop - once you've beaten one skirmish match you've beaten them all given the absolutely barebones AI.
- [b]Boring, tedious main gameplay loop[/b]
- [b]The UI is a mess.[/b]  Here's the process to create and join a coop vs AI game:
[olist]
   [*]Select the correct region at the top before hitting create
   [*]Set Rival Corps to 1, set the player/AI slider to 1 AI, 0 players.
   [*]Start game, your friends will not be able to join at the start, there's no lobby
   [*]You must build an executron facility before your game is joinable
   [*]Have your friend input the game password in the password field
   [*]Have your friend swap regions multiple times until a green "Join as Executron" button appears to the right of your game in the list
[/olist]

[h1]Major Pros:[/h1]
- One of the few games in the FPS+RTS genre
- Asymmetrical coop
- Visually excellent
- Solid concept that could shine with some common sense quality of life improvements
- Replayability if you're interested in PvP against friends, or against an entrenched and experienced playerbase (You'll need to ask in the search for groups channel on their discord though, since there's no consistent population)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989338978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1698168276}
review:
Der Mix aus Echtzeit Strategie und FPS bzw. direkt Kontrolle von Raumschiffen macht sehr viel Spaß. Das Spiel ist auf einen super weg, schön wäre noch ein paar Komfort Funktionen und ein größeres Flottenlimit. 
Ansonsten macht es jetzt schon eine Menge Spaße und für zwischendurch (solange noch keine Kampagne enthalten ist) ist es auf jeden Fall ein Blick wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078735682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1703543695}
review:
This game has *so* much potential, but the scope of the world and the breadth of available paths are so limited.
You start the game with a station in some system, with access to a few other systems, maybe 10 total. The only other entity in the game world is an enemy station on the opposite side of the map. Build ships, expand your station, and take out the enemy. This is the extent of your agency as the player. Want to expand, build, mine and trade in a world (or galaxy) that feels *alive?* No such luck. At least not yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969096617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1641383447}
review:
The Short:

I've had this game sitting in my library for years, and in that time I really can't say I've seen any real development take place. It's shallow, slow, and quickly loses it's rts/fps novelty.

The Long:

I bought this game originally to support it but it's clear the devs are making little to no progress, and the current state, which is little to no different than what it was a few years ago, is probably going to be close to what it is released as.

I have only played in single player, which is currently limited to a max of 2 opponents and 9 systems, and feels tiny. With how slow the game moves (specifically ships) you can expect a game to last no less than 45 minutes, usually going for hours with the first 25 just building up resource ships and a base. I honestly AFK at the start of matches after starting my build que since there is nothing to do.

Ship control is portrayed as epic, but is really only cool for about 2 minutes before you realize that the only real benefit of controlling a ship is cinematics and flying the incredibly slow tugboat to manually scout, it has little benefit in combat, in fact you are more likely to do worse than autofire.

FPS in stations is ok, you do actually benefit by taking control sometimes in that and is the only place where rts actually shines, although dimly. Troop transports are a pain to use, and honestly so tedious I stopped using them as why would I bother capturing a station when the game already moves so slow and it's just easier to blow up and replace? Tactically it costs more time and resources to capture an existing station than to just destroy it.

Everything else in the game is unbalanced, automated or just dull. I can't see any reason why anyone would buy this game over any other generic RTS on the market other than the RTS/FPS combo novelty which is frankly just a poor experience in this game. This game needs a LOT of work to get to being worthwhile and good, and I don't see that ever happening with these devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307756700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 203, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1711259245}
review:
This is an awesome game, with TONS of potential. The Concept is phenomenal, and Incredibly fun. The creator of this game is devoted, and is frequently giving new material, updates, and overhauls to make the game even better. I have had this game for a while, and it is spectacular, to come back every once in a while and see all the new changes. The graphics look amazing, and my PC runs it well. 
The factions update adds alot of variety, to a game that already had tons of variability. Having asymmetric factions is tough to balance, but a blast to play against. The RTS is brilliant, and The FPS can be intriguing, though, a bit slow at times. 
10/10 would buy again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034703607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1901, 'last_played': 1663163520}
review:
Executive Assault 2 looks good and appears to have a very positive review list but has many flaws that are both large and small and i will happily list them for you to consider of why you should or should not put your money on this game:

1): The servers are practically empty. There are for the longest time of owning this game for half a year at least so far almost no servers in this game and when there are there is about at max 5 i have ever seen. 

2) Default game movement control issues. The ability to move in the game generally is in a way wonky and has a very sensitive mouse cursor (much like Star Wars Republic Commando if you ever tried it). the speed at which you are moving is difficult to bear as its as if you are speed running and makes the experience uncomfortable. 

3): The inability to talk. Yup, you read it. This game has no ability whatsoever to communicate via voice chat between executrons (player assistants) to the  CEO player. The only voice communication that was once enabled was a 15 second voice transmission only for the CEO. All other forms of communication are by text and that can be incredibly annoying especially with the power issues between executron and CEO.

4): CEO power abuse. The CEO or person who owns the faction when the game starts up can open up an executron factory which allows other players to join in the game as executrons. All executrons are other people basically and their goal is to do what their boss tells them to do in short and simple. The CEO has the ability to kick any executron they desire with or without reason. So add this up with a poor text based communication (#3) and the rarity of servers that pop up (#1), and you may get kicked by the only server there for the week or longer based on a misunderstood order or just because the CEO didn't like you for whatever reason.

5): The bots here are not the smartest. The bots in this game commonly get stuck on corners of the building and when trying to raid an enemy base with a large amount of robots and  it goes down a single file line trickle, your not going to have a good time. 

6): You cant aim. As an executron with some of the rifles that seem to have a scope attached in FPS mode you can right click hold to 'aim' but it is not down the sights, instead it is just zooming your FPS camera screen by about 20% giving you the feel that your head is closer beside the gun. Not a very fun feature to me. 

7): EA2 (Executive Assault 2) discord server is practically unheard of. Believe it or not but there is a discord server for this game! The only problem that i noticed with it is that there is a lack of using the discord chat for the game. Fortunately, this might be a valid solution for solving the problem with #3 IF the discord is made more aware of directly to the game... Or until voice chat is enabled in the game. 

8): Difficulties landing. When playing as an executron, the game mechanics dictate that you have to press a certain button to initiate a landing sequence instead of landing that is much more free willed and manual in any other game. Trust me, ive tried landing manually but every attempt ends up being a crash in the force field right outside the hangar in all forms of stations. 

That is all the problems in the game that i have noticed so far and i hope you take these problems into consideration for purchasing the game at this time.

review:
This is what we all have been wanting, RTS, FPS, type game yeah sure it's still basic atm, but if they keep working on it this can be a huge success I enjoy playing just to have fun and mess around.

The AI does not give you a chance so you best learn and build fast or with a friend, they will rip you apart, also you can lose the game just by accidently falling into a hole keep that in mind if your far into a game XD

All in all it's super cool to watch your ships outside past by your window and do what they need to do with droids at your side to protect you

author: {'steamid': '76561198068886444', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1196, 'last_played': 1693926421}
review:
UPDATED REVIEW
------------------------------
The new 'Asteroids' Update has been released and with it the game has changed in a wonderful way that is now more akin to the Original 'Executive Assault' 

The Core RTS Experience in this game is wonderful (If a little janky at times) with the main game being a resource gathering, base-building space game about invading your enemies base and assassinating his leader. Which is where the Unique Quirk of Exec Assault 2 shines, rather than spamming the biggest units until you blow up the building this game features a unique FPS mode which lets you get close and personal and explore EVERY single building and corridor you have created. Even letting you use the panels inside to construct new units (ETC)

Whilst the FPS experience is the weaker part of this game due to it's uhh... unpolished animations and awful aiming, it is still a charm you can't deny seeing your space armada duking it out above you in real time. (And yes that looks as incredible as you imagine) Thanks to the new asteroids update you can now land your forces at your enemies door using Drop-Pods, Hybrid Space to Ground mechs... Teleports... Spy-Plants? There's a lot of unique ways to win this thing!

The trading system and 'Goods' system is not to my tastes personally, and often feels like it's just a tacked on resource, there should be a more elaborate way of delivering your companies goods so that they could possibly be intercepted or put on hold, as really it just feels like busy work to get you a little boost in research points and such. 

The FPS in bases as i described was pretty cool! But the FPS cockpit view of the Star Fighters is a little jarring, and often results in you just being better off letting the AI handle things! (Perhaps that's my awful flying tho)

Factions are lack luster in my opinion, or at least i never bothered trying to make friends with them as by the time i'd even headed out to other systems i had a big enough fleet to obliterate them. Which does bring me to a personal warning... Don't leave you star system undefended, the 'Protestors' will occasionally storm your main base and attempt to actually kill you. i learnt this the hard way.

All in all Executive Assault 2 is a highly experimental feeling game which should be bought for it's unique features and for a cool factor, do not expect the polish of a triple A title, but rather enjoy it's unique offerings! If you have some friends to play with this game can honestly be an absolute blast to play, you could even have a friend helping as an 'Executron' which is his own unique spawn-able unit which can help you build or defend you. (Or if you want you could just both have your own team and enjoy big space battles which is ALWAYS cool)

review:
Still needs a good bit of development and balancing but im eager to see what the developers make! Judging by their first game (which is a hidden gem) I am very optimistic!

Things that need attention as of the latest update: 
Landing and boarding mechanics and balance
expanded economy / resource balance
better attack and defence AI (right now it just seems like there is too much micro for the rts)

Update:
definitely some promising development, still needs polish but its coming together!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965377530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1600104160}
review:
Was soll ich sagen.....eigentlich eine super Idee und auch nicht schlecht umgesetzt. Ich hoffe der Entwickler bleibt dran und veröffentlicht in naher Zukunft mehr Inhalt. Dann kauf ich es mir evtl. noch einmal. Aber zurzeit bietet es mir zu wenig Inhalt. Ein richtiges Handelsimperium kann man nicht aufbauen. Alles wirkt alles ein wenig Oberflächlich. Die Grafik ist zweckmässig aber könnte sicher eine kleine Überholung brauchen :-) Vor allem die Kantenbildung sorgt (in der heutigen Zeit) für Stirnrunzeln. Zudem finde ich die Tastenbelegung unglücklich. Wieso kann ich nicht die rechte Maustaste, sondern muss links CTRL für die Kamearotation verwenden? Auch das diese immer wieder zurückspringt und nicht in meiner gewählten Ansicht bleibt nervt ein wenig.

Deshalb wer unbedingt so ein Spiel sucht kann jetzt schon zuschlagen. Alle anderen sollten, sowie noch ein wenig warten. Schlecht ist es jedenfalls nicht.

review:
游戏的玩法很少见，很出色，但是在帧数上有点不尽人意，虽然有FPS元素但主要是RTS玩法FPS辅助，个人感觉是蛮有意思的，而且制作组还在不断地更新游戏玩法，不过好与否还是仁者见仁智者见智。

很希望制作组能够早点制作中文

但买之前根本不看支持语言的，还在评论差评显得自己有钱买游戏没脑子玩游戏的，咋们能不能别再给国人玩家丢人了？
游戏没中文的确恼人，但这不是给差评的理由，更不是宣泄自己不满的理由。

给个更好的建议，隔壁星际争爸有中文，而且还有中文配音，连字幕都不用看了，还免费，免得要退款，更方便更直接。

author: {'steamid': '76561198044277995', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1693650685}
review:
This game has incredible potential. It is currently not optimized particularly well, but it will hopefully get there. I am writing this review as a plead to the developers of features I would find very interesting ingame, however impossible they may seem.

First off I am so happy they brought back the troop transports! I however miss the docking on external ports, I got a special star-wars feel whenever I saw the doors open and my troops sally out. I really hope for any type of boarding pods, or such thing to board the biggest ships, and have ship battles. This could be made by having a small crew on capital ships that count towards "infantry" population. (15 or so guys on a ship). They would be supported by interior defences and such. And the whole point of the boarding would be to go to the engine of the ship, destroying it to detonate the ship. 

For this to work there would have to be some buffs to ship health to make this a thing you would want to do.

I would be absolutely be thrilled if the main base was on a planet, and the place we build big ships would just be a space station. I can imagine after conquring space, that you have to conquer the planet that your base is on (or a little map) with a planetary invasion and orbital bombarment. With the incredibly smart system of construction and RTS/FPS that exists in the game, I can imagine bunkers and defensive lines, or other ways of defence, depending on the faction!

And a good thing to invest in would be a planetary defence cannon, that can only shoot the biggest and deadliest ships. (Just so you cant use the monolith to devastate the planet)

I can imagine conquering the planetary defence cannon so it cannot retaliate, and thereafter pulverize the planet, uuuu getting shivers.


Oh- add robots that do maintainance and such around the space station once we can get the unit caps really high.

I believe in some sort of version of everything I said because I can see the amount of work Hesketh studios are putting into this project! And I truly believe that are going to implement some really cool features :) 

For now, I would be happy if big ships could dock, and executrons could pilot my flagship, and tell me things from a tactical view :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198100027596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5478, 'last_played': 1623501466}
review: If you like the base building of supcom and like taking control of your own units like warhammer than youll like Executive Assault 2. There are ups and downs but I hope they continue adding more to this style of game cause its enjoyable for you RTS strategy types. This game goes further with indirect control by being able to control almost anything on your station from units to turrets. The downs are its vague as there is only fighting and no missions or campaigns and the AI difficulty is easy to predict as medium and brutal are close of each other. Only can build 50 units but some of these are massive so itll save your computer from overheating and dropping frames. I would say its good as 7 of 10 overall with the added factions recently. A game I would keep an eye on for big updates cause there is potential to be a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971706261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1705490748}
review:
Executive Assault the small RTS/fps Indy-Gem that manages to give you the great vibe of 1970s to 1980s Space-Operas with lots of pew, pew and glorious space action underlined by an as epic soundtrack. It's already great fun for 2 players but it's even better when you have a bunch of friends running arround as executrons aiding your CEO. 

The foundation is very solid but of course I have a wishlist of things that I hope will come in the future:
- Additional CEOs with different Genders and Species may be even a pure Robotic faction resembling Cylons from BSG.
- Optimised performance. 
- Bridge and/or turret view for the bigger vessels that you can controll while you are fighting. Additional stations on a single Vessel so that one Dreadnought could be controlled by several people. (would be nice to have, not a must)
- Different corridoors for the bigger pods of your fleet. (also nice to have but no must either)
- A possibility to connect portals to your large vessels instead of clicking back and forth as executron on the map.
- Instead of multiple portal per station just one but with a dialing terminal to switch destinations (not a must)
- Classic Sci-Fi vintage explosion sounds (the infamous double kabooms... this I would consider a must have) 
- the ability to take over enemy vessels. 
- tbc. 
- A blue box and an army of angry tincan-mutants wanting to EXTERMINATE everything.

Conclusion: The multiplayer alone is worth a buy if you have a least one friend who is fan of vintage sci-fi or somebody who feels like  she/he is mood for lasers and lots of explosions. It has the potential to surpass battlezone and EA1. It already feels better than both of those.

review:
Tak zatím je to dost předčasné...ale vypadá to kurevsky dobře.
Po třech hodinách, které utekly jak prd, musím konstatovat, že jsem se celou dobu opravdu nenudil...procházky po stanicích, ovládání lodí, továren...boje jak z command postu tak i v pilotním křesle a pár přestřelek na chodbách...prostě paráda...do toho výzkum, opravování...nádhera.

Kdo má rád RTS, budování a nevadí mu si zabojovat...kupujte...

author: {'steamid': '76561198045586844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1693657866}
review:
It is a mix 50% recommendation and 50% not recommended. Don't get me wrong. The reason i put No recommendation is due to lack of content.Sure it is EA but at least if you have another faction to make sure different play style. I know Developer are working on it and i support it. But not everyone will do it. I had a blast playing with my mates. It looks cool when your ship are engaging the enemy and having fps mode staying in the ship looks totally awesome. Anyone who wants a mix experience on RTS and FPS mode , i would definitely recommend this game. But you will get easily bored after you tried it since there is only one faction , at least it was for me.There are few bugs but for me but it was not a game breaking. It was for my mates when he deploy a monolith (a super big size starwars ship) and jump to another planet and lost connection. The graphics are okay . I am not a Graphics guy who wants the best. If there are a lot of content , i don't mind the graphics. For those who want 2012 and above better graphics , i would not recommend it. 

Overrall:Positive
Cool FPS and RTS mix. i will give it 5.5 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972779358', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1593993019}
review:
No where near finished or even as advertised. Both the RTS and FPS are both terribly executed and very clunky. The graphics are pre 2005 and the sound is minimal. I get that it perhaps scratches a niche for some, but i have doubt that it will ever reach much of a height.

And dont get me started on the horrible UI. 

The game is too early to be playable. I wish it the best, but i cannot recommend it to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331600937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1652454026}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049219599', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1700159953}
review:
Executive Assault 2 is a game where you as a player can choose to become a CEO of your own Company!

In Strategy mode, you are the commander! you build and Manage your Space Station, build goods to sell to a trade and in return buy Tech and or Ressources. you have to Research Tech to Upgrade your Ships, weapons, bots and Station and much much more! The game gives you a lot of possible gameplay styles!

But what makes the game so great is that you are able to take control of almost all Units by and sit in the Captains chair and shoot the living hell out of your enemys or just simply watch the Epic space battle on the Bridge inside of your Frigate, Cruiser , Battleship and more to watch your Plan and Strategys unfold infront of you!
Multiplayer is the most fun, where your friends can Join as a Executron and do the FPS mode dirty work for you! You can Command a fleet or just bring in a Command troop of Marine Bots inside the enemy station to assasinate the enemy CEO! It really is Fun! Your friend can Launch fighters, take Control of Units, Build units bots and much more. Communication is a must so you tell him what to do and you can do other stuff! Imagine having 12 friends in a lobby and you tell them what to do!

Pros: Has a Lot of Weapons, tech reasearch and a lot of play Options
         Multiplayer with your friends is so much fun if you can find friends that play this game
         It is worth a buy
         You will have fun in the Strategy mode and also in the FPS mode!
         This game is underrated, which means its Under fucking rated

Cons: Frames Drop sometimes when you disable station roof or sometimes also random
          Too low Fleetcap in my oppinion (might add a option to increase this)
          Only one Race (Faction) to play
          

Update addition: They are planning a second Faction at the Moment which adds more ships and different playstyle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062110772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1670780765}
review:
Potential for a really great game.. Lost on lack of updates/attention it deserves. No Campaign, very limited to what you can build. Caps on fleet/units/buildings quite annoying for modern tech considering other games similar to this have 10x the limit. I just really want to see some better improvements for the money each person spends when buying this. Make it worth our time even for an EA. Considering the game says you can control multiple ships in multiple fleets.. its not even close to that. The Fleet cap only makes up about 1 fleet In my honest opinion.

This new recent update for me really ruins the game play as it was currently. Theres really not even close to enough ships/tech/buildings in game to split it up into 3 categories like they decided to limiting its already very limited content to now having to choose do you want or this? Which sounds great for different play styles... if there was more content to enjoy it with.. 1 style literally only have 3 titan ships... lame, another has a giant laser weapon that when charged apparently can destroy enemy stations from other side of map.. seems too OP to me. and they removed transport ships from being avail for all 3 classes something which every class should included for the boarding enemy stations thing.. you kind of ruin that feature when you take away certain abilities to actually board... if no transports and no gateway station how? and then at that point what is the use of even making robots other then to defend against the enemy who decided to pick the class with gateway station or the transport..

author: {'steamid': '76561198047588172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1700696238}

author: {'steamid': '76561198101490391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1704574886}
review:
This game is fun and I enjoy that this game has both RTS and FPS in the same game and can switch from a ship to a soldier like that. Flying ships is really fun and somewhat easy to use, but you just have to go easy on the mouse since that's the steering wheel. Also, Controlling your robots are easy to use as well. When you control your ships, you can look at yours ships engage enemy ships without directly controlling which I think is cool. I like how you can board enemy outpost and HQs. I hope they add where you can board enemy ships too; I haven't research that far into the game yet so I hope so. The research is a bit generic, but ok. The music is good once you hear it, but it gets old and annoying way too fast. The combat music is good, but you will get sick of it eventually. Everything about the diplomacy is pointless. The factions just randomly ask for credits and if you don't give it to them, the just blow up your station. 
Overall, I enjoy playing this game and I hope the developer(s) add more to the game. However, I'm not satisfied with the price since its too much for it be Early access. Its something I will be playing for a while and I hope he adds more to the game before it becomes boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086667209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1595537505}
review:
Great blend of genres. The kind of game where you can look out of the window of your space station and see your fleets flying around, engaged in combat and spend 10 minutes just staring at them only to get headshot from behind because you completely forgot that you were in the middle of defending your base from invaders, because man those space battles look awesome! :D

It is still in early access so it's a got it's rough edges. UI and tutorial could use some work but I've git high hopes for this game and I'm looking forward to seeing it progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264070272', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1639106656}
review:
Amazing potential and currently a great starting point. The number one thing needed right now is the ability for more systems to be placed, the ability to increase fleet cap and army cap, and allow more station parts to be added.  All i keep thinking is "wow i wish i could build more than one docking bay" it would be amazing to have more station things too such as an office hall where a team of workers can boost sales or even a Human training room where expensive but powerful units could be trained and even have the company logo on it.     

Letting us choose colors and even some kind of marketing part of the game could go a long way.           Making the infestation of aliens or even alien hives full of money and resources would be great as well.                            Its an amazing game especialy with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254193290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1545621836}
review:
Like others below, I like the premise of this game. It has a lot of potential. But all it as atm is a poorly executed idea. Its buggy as hell, has very little content, and after 3 hours you'll be done with it. The FPS and cockpit modes are a novelty, everything is so hard to control that its not worth it at all. 

Clearly this developer is just trying to make a few bucks while not putting any effort whatsoever into continued development. As long as he can post some shiny videos and screenshots that will entice people to pony up 10$, he's happy. That's my take anyways. Dont waste your $$, even for 10$
developer_response:
Hi there, sorry you didn't enjoy game, there is plenty of development going on in the experimental branch which is being updated a few times a week in preparation to release to the main one.
You can join the discord and fantastic community at https://discord.gg/ranDWCU which will show you how to get to the latest updates such as the new faction system which is currently being worked on and has been for the last few months which adds loads of new tech, units and different styles of game play.

Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027845723', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1313, 'last_played': 1699113557}
review:
Amazing. Bit to learn at the start but once you get past that stage its worth it. Simply being able to switch to one of your boarding crew jump out the ship with however many soldiers you brought along with you and all fight your way to the command centre fighting through the other teams defenders is amazing while a whole space battle is happening right outside.

Would love for them to expand on the boarding party side of things as would be great to see better areas to defend and kill boxes we can create within our base, mg positions set up which your men have to mand and troops able to take cover better?, peak round walls and so on. 

Overall a lot of things could be added to the game in its current form but still a great game for right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215296116', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3851, 'last_played': 1679769231}
review:
It is a really fun and innovative game , there are some bugs but in the discord you can directly talk with the developer of this game and in most cases if bugs are reported they are fixed quickly
It is impressive that this game is Developed by a single person 

So onto gameplay , The FPS part is rough but still good enough and the visuals are almost stunning in some cases 
It is just a great feeling beeing in the bridge of a large battlecruiser , walking up to the glass and seeing you whole fleet prepare to jump to warp speed
There are new and Innovative additions in almost any update , new units , ships , station parts , or even completely new systems 

Now the next announced update will make the game more open and add a lot of new things to do , it also increases the system number from max 9 to max 26 ,and rework the ship loadoutsystem , this seems like it will be another great addition by hesketh

review:
Needs a lot of work in my opinion. I was instantly hit with how 'empty' and in need of polish it was but I like the concept.

UPDATE: This game is still not in good shape; the camera can't be focused--or if it can the tutorial doesn't say how to focus it on an object--the tutorial does not explain how to build a 'mining outpost construction ship' and I don't see it in the list.

Additionally the tutorial does not explain how to capture a system it simply tells you to do it.

I couldn't handle it after that and had to turn it off, a bit frustrating to say the least.

Good concept; still needs a LOT of work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085931811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1585580232}
review:
So I just bought this to make sure I wasn't just assuming things after all. After the disappointment and terrible treatment I got throughout my time with the first game, I just didn't have any hopes anymore, but I wanted to believe. Sadly, I was right. And I knew I was in for a great start when I found the first bug 5 seconds from the moment I was able to control the CEO. Yeah, that's not how a "reload" works.

So anyway, I tried out a few things. To speed up things, cause I sure will not go beyond the refund limit, I've also tried one "creative" match. I really don't want to waste as much time and effort as I did with the previous title, so to keep it short:

- Despite what I was told, this game feels exactly like the first and is perfectly comparable.
- The UI needs work.
- The animations, if present, still feel extremely rigid and unsatisfying.
- Overall sound design, or rather the lack of it, leaves no room for immersion.
- Performance is quite terrible. A few larger ships and some fighters quickly dropped the framerate into the 30's. And that's with a 3950X and a 2080 Ti, though neither even cared. The game is just as bottlenecked by itself as the first one. You'll be going for very short matches if you want a decent experience.
- The controls made me want to uninstall within 10 minutes. Pro tip: Never misplace a corridor. You might hurt yourself trying to select it...and then proceed to wait a whole minute until it VERY slowly explodes in order to get rid of it.
- Graphics wise, this game is 95% over the top lightning/reflections. Yes, it looks nice on screenshots and trailers. Yes, you'll get tired of it very quickly.
- The multiplayer is dead. Period. Haven't seen a single lobby. No different from the first one. If you want to play this, you'll need friends. And you'll want friends to play this.
- I didn't even bother trying how the AI works indoors, given the performance issues this game has. But from ship fights alone, it was rather chaotic.
- The price tag is way too high for what's offered. This should be 10 bucks at most. And that's being generous. Honestly, make it 3 or 5 and try to make use of a niche. Or at least give people the "Ah well, it was just 5 bucks" feeling and leave yourself some room to work with.

I could go on, but if I give too much feedback I'll get banned again. At least that's the treatment I got when I once put trust into this developer. From my experience with the first game, I can only figure that the developer hates if you point out too many bugs and might ban you along with all your posts. Of course, I am not saying he will, I am just saying that's what he did to me. So I doubt much improvement is ever gonna happen. Which does seem like a reasonable assumption, given it's been out since October 2018 and still has such a terrible first impression. God...I still don't understand how a single man project, of all things, would be so iron against actual feedback and bug testing.

Anyway, I'll be refunding as this recent hands-on experience gave me nothing but reasons to refund it. In a very short time frame, no less. The idea is, just like the first game, very interesting. But the execution, no pun intended, is utterly lacking.

Bonus: The monolith superweapon does not know friend nor foe. If you press that button in your sector, it will nuke your own base, and you cannot stop it. Oversight or feature...hard to tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047816872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1584235408}
review:
At its core it's a fun game, but the lack of polish and abundance of bugs makes the initial appeal wear off pretty quickly.

There are multiple features which are consistently made unusable by glitches (like activating the Monolith's "death star" weapon), and the gameplay itself wavers between acceptable and clunky. The RTS aspects are decent - somewhat reminiscent of Empire at War - but the experience is dulled by more irritating bugs (many ships will start to follow an order, and then stop halfway through; some of them will just ignore you completely and continue flying to their deaths).

The FPS aspect is nothing more than a novelty; while piloting your own ships/controlling your own soldiers does allow you to perform better than the AI pilots, the whole experience is too clunky and unresponsive to make it worth while, much less fun.

Overall, again, the core idea of the game is great, and if you're like me, you'll likely waste a few hours trying your best to squeeze some enjoyment out of it, but all-in-all this game is just a poorly executed, disappointing mess, despite 2 years of development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134504776', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4844, 'last_played': 1675546444}
review:
You're probably wondering why you should buy this game? 
Well ask yourself this, do you like games where you can either control a robot who can burn an entire station to the ground by hiding under the station, or do you like games where you can play in RTS mode while at the same time take control of a robot who can burn a station? 
If you answer yes to either of those questions then this is the game for you! 
From a one man army controlling a fighter capable of burning stations to giant monoliths capable of destroying everything in a system, from small battles onboard stations to giant fleets battling for control over a system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074753996', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1605846771}
review:
Certainly a great emerging style of game. Its addicting and i can't wait to see what happens in future updates. To help out seeking buyers I'll list some ups and downs.
Pros
-Easy to get the concept and ideas of. As well as easy and fun to understand
-cool *** space battles, as well as boarding parties onto enemy stations
-Nice graphics for an early access game
-Fun and addicting to play all around in general (I played 2, 2 hour sessions and didn't even notice how much time had passed)

Cons
-In between tip of the ice berg and slightly in-depth on mechanics and items in the games. Although the research tree is fleshed out a bit I'd like to see some unique station design.
-Only doors are hack-able (I know its a strange thing to point out but hear me out). If your raiding a station and its in condition red you'd want to find a terminal to disable that so you'd have a much easier time raiding the station. It'd be nice to see a class of bot that could achieve something like that.
-(relating to my last point) Few bot classes, there a big opportunity to really put some specilization into that category and possibly some more mechs aswell.

All in all its a fabulous start and I can't wait to see what comes next. Certainly a fun concept to mix fps and rts and the game really plays on it well. Very addicting gameplay and its satisfying when you win, especially if it was a hard fought game.
