author: {'steamid': '76561198007295020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 6191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1697167868}
review:
After only 5 years, the game is out of early access, whew, with an asking price of $25, which is about $24 too much.  It's a vanity project for the developer and a few fan boys.  Otherwise, everything written below about the state of the game and it's playability remains on point.  If you like cramped game concepts, limited development options, and poor replayability, then go for it.

It would be a good idea, if you're considering buying into this now four year old 'Early Access' game to recconsider.  While asking you to invest in the project, the developer has made it clear that only those approved opinions of the game will be considered and then only if you are on the Discord.  Normal discussion is not allowed to influence decisions about game play problems.  Having stated on the page offering the game for sale that opinions are welcomed and will be considered on the discussion forum, this is not the case; and the developer makes periodic changes to be assessed only by a select group. all other opinion labeled as 'hostile' and a bother.  The result is a mishmash of changes, not all bad, but arbitrary with little documentation to explain the changes or rationale for doing so.  Not sure how long a game can justify being early access, but given the arbitrary nature of the current product, let the buyer beware.  The comments below were made over a year or more ago.  While some of the evaluations below don't reflect later changes, including some real improvements--then undone by later 'improvements'--not much has changed.

Once again, the developer has added a bunch of stuff that comes with no documentation, no explanation, no idea on how to use all the added items.  So, it's back to not recommending this to anyone.

Tutorial information has limited utility and some odd glitches where sentences aren't finished.

The trade mechanics are unclear, especially since this is one of the areas of greatest changes that makes the game more interesting.

Sectors are still woefully lacking in resources and control over resource gathering is awkward at best.

The tech tree remains scanty, although station development options are much improved.



Came back after months to find the game little better than first release.  Claims for improvements, like claims that video footage of fleet engagements are from actual game play, test the limits of veracity.  The tutorial is laughable.  The depth of play is a mile wide and and an inch deep.  Still in early access after all this time has passed.  No campaign game.  Galaxy is limited to 9 systems, which of course aren't systems just grid squares with a few resource nodes.  Opponents are limited to 2.  Replay is, therefore, not just repetitive but pointless.  Ship battles are in slow motion.  Research is cumbersome and ship slots only allow a couple of options so you can't, for example choose shields and armor; similar limits on weapons, missiles or beams or cannons.  Diplomacy is pointless.  So, it's back on the back shelf for me.  If you're thinking about buying, well, caveat emptor.


There's a potentially decent game in here somewhere, but so far the developer(s) hasn't found it.  Indeed it seems to get more muddled with the updates.  Not sure how long a game can claim to be in early access and not see real improvements (see comment above) in basics, though opponents are upped to 3.  So, back on the shelf.  Maybe someday.

So, after the latest patch, came back to see if things got better.  Simple answer: NO.

The patches seem to address things that are irrelevant--you can choose your player color--rather than address substantive problems.  

A litany:

The whole system setup, that is where the action begins in a particular system/sector, is feeble.  A corporation is supposed to have made a serious decision to invest in a station in a system that has virtually no sustaining resources--ironite.  On the easiest setting this is only around 30000.  This makes it virtually impossible to develop the defense assets one needs when the AI starts spamming attacks, which it can do in the dozens in the time it takes the player forever to accrue anything worthwhile.  Additional assets can be bought, but traders show up with virtually useless amounts of ironite much of which has to then go into the production of goods for sale.  So, you're constantly strapped for money--unless you use the cheat code, which obviates the whole design for game play, meaning you can spam just like the AI.  No strategy needed.  

There's no real diplomacy.

There's no real economy, and what there is is screwy.  It takes, for example 500 ironite to build the simplest space ship and 230 to build the basic soldier.  Really?  More than half the cost of a spaceship for a soldier?

There's really nothing to do worth doing.  Nice graphics don't make up for poor conception.

9/23/20:

More useless updates from the developer.  Doesn't address real problems/issues.

AI opponents still spam attacks.
Pricing structure for ships/soldiers is screwy--a single mechanoid costs more than most starships.
Research tree is a farce.
Equipment options are a joke.
No strategy need apply.
Base buildings are too limited to sustain the game, even if there were fixes.
Ships still move as if stuck in aspic.
Ships don't respond to attackers and the limited options for directing them don't.
Can't build more than one base per system, so no defense bases, research bases, which if there was a decent research tree would be interesting.  But no.
Resources per system are laughable.
Game, after all this time, still can't make up its mind to do something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017212820', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1689106688}
review:
This is amazing.

for a early access game this is great so far, the feeling you get when breaking a defense line with giant battleships to get the "death star" into the area is a feeling worthy of the asking price

review: Ich bin gespannt auf die Weiterentwicklung dieses Spiels... Es macht einen sehr guten Eindruck ! Die Raumschiffe bewegen sich sehr realistisch... Die Effekte sind echt gelungen... Es ähnelt Stellaris im Mix mit einem FPS... Etwas größere Galaxien und mehr Content und es wird ein Toptitel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065396602', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1632396277}
review:
Per adesso è molto più no che si. Per essere del 2018 è realizzato molto molto male, dai testi alle icone ad alcune texture: quelle esterne delle navi molto dettagliate ma gli interni dei posti e altri elementi nemmeno da playstation 1. Musiche carine ma alcuni audio piuttosto baggati. Il gioco al momento è molto povero di contenuti con una IA che anche su facile già al terzo attacco metterà in difficoltà il giocatore. Da sistemare tante piccole cose come lo zoom al momento fastidioso come è fatto, icone varie, IA che si blocca dietro le porte mentre i propri robot che invece di mantenere la posizione si muovono o non sparano al nemico che è davanti a loro. Personalmente dovrebbero proprio ri-concepire 3/4 di gioco perchè altrimenti si tratta solo di un "fai una flotta e con un click gli fai fare tutti i pianeti per attaccare il nemico", cosi non risulta divertente ne strategico e vince chi spamma di più. Nemmeno ho sorvolato l'idea di provare il multiplayer. Peccato, perchè può avere del potenziale.
AGGIORNAMENTO 23/09/21
Qualche miglioramento sicuramente c'è stato ma resta un gioco molto povero e privo di contenuti, sembra di giocare a un gioco vecchissimo, noioso e avvolte inutilmente complicato. L'unica cosa che si salva è la possibilità di controllare direttamente le unità ed esplorare gli interni. Non compratelo al prezzo che chiedono loro, non ne vale la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981361931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1711037872}

author: {'steamid': '76561198092563641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1711044642}
review:
Das Spiel ist ist für den jetzigen Stand der Entwicklung klasse. Die Grafik ist ausreichend, mehr muss nicht.

Ja es gibt Bugs und Dinge die einen Wahnsinnig machen..

- im Skirmish der Executron Modus ist total verbuggt, einmal hat sich das Spiel in dem Modus komplett aufgehängt. Man hat keinerlei Karte wo man auf der Station ist und rennt sich einen Wolf. Die Idee ist geil, gefällt mir super, muss aber  gefeilt werden um damit Spaß haben zu können. 

- im Skirmish gesetzte Einstellungen muss man jedes mal neu machen,...das nervt mich bisher am meisten, richtig nervig. Zuletzt gespiele Karten gehen dadurch auch verloren.

-So heftig der Forschungsbaum ist. So langweilig ist die Schiffsauswahl...hoffe da kommt mehr.

-An Board eines Schiffs gibt es nichts zu tun, es können zb. keine Geschütztürme einzeln gesteuert werden, auf Carrier kann man in einen Fighter umsteigen...zurück an Board landen leider nicht.

-Es gibt eine Art Maintence Turm, der hat bei mir im Spiel bisher nicht funktioniert.

review: For an Early Access game its not bad i do recommend getting it if intrested; To me the AI is pretty difficult on easy difficulties but that might be me sucking at it lol. Still alot of fun with yourself and others. Multiplayer mode is Great so far you can go against friends with friends fighting as your personal guard (Executioners) or take on the AI with a squad of about 14 friends as executioners. P.S. To HESKETH Studios I have to say good job so far i cannot wait to see it get better over time. [Also If you get the game and want to Coop with someone then HMU i wont mind joining u].

author: {'steamid': '76561198090738648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1577241246}
review:
In its current state, this game is not worth playing or buying. The content of the game is VERY early access and frankly shouldn't have been released in this state. 

There is no campaign, only skirmish. In this state the functions within the game aren't even developed enough and still contains bugs. Honestly i think it should have been iterated on and developed for a few more months before being released with a more polished product.

Will try again in a year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313607242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1704466473}
review: Ich liebe es. Der 2. Teil ist noch umfangreicher als der 1. Nun muss man mit verschiedenen Völkern diplomatisch arbeiten und mit ihnen Waren und Rohstoffe handeln, man muss den umfangreichen Skill-Tree erforschen, darf im eigenen Raumschiff in Weltraumschlachten mitkämpfen oder als Bodeneinheit im First-Person-Shooter-Style die gegnerische Basis infiltrieren. An der Grafik erkennt man, dass es kein Triple-A Spiel ist und an manchen Ecken ist es (Early Access wohlgemerkt) noch verbuggt, aber die Bugs hindern nicht mein Gameplay. Ich mag den Humor, als CEO einer Aktiengesellschaft verkaufe ich Comicbücher im Weltall und bekriege mich mit anderen Firmen. Dem Spiel würde ich mehr Aufmerksamkeit wünschen, aber vermutlich wird es immer ein Indie-Titel bleiben. Wem schon Battlezone gefallen hat, sollte einen Blick riskieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040981899', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1576459046}
review:
I really like it, like REALLY like it, this one fix the the problem of making it feel like your fighting a huge space war, but it does have it's own issues.

1. Range. Most of the ship to ship weapons feel like you have to be in spiting distance, so clone they look like their gonna ram each other, especially with the huge capital ship that takes 33% of the map. i feel the weapons should scale with the ship class, the bigger the class the more range.

2. Pacing. A large part of the the problem is it just feels so slow, the cheats in skirmish help some but it still feels sluggish.

3. Camera control. I don't how to spell this out, but it just needs some tweaking, maybe Right Click allows free-cam

Don't know if the Dev is gonna see this but i wanna give him some props for this game, only one dude made thiswhole game and it kicks ass

author: {'steamid': '76561198084071539', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1640020700}
review:
Very promising, needs more work on variation and navy design, updates are good so far, hope it stays its pace. There are noticeable problems like UI contrast and scaling, among other things such as bloom around planets and awkward movement of ships and our beloved robot armies pathing in stations. The AI is a tad bit wonky and it really is confusing seeing its actions, not that it's bad nor unnerving or anything. I usually make a decent two to three paragraph review but this game is still in the first stages of early access so there's not much I can say yet before getting a full palmed grasp of the games' opportunities of strategy and future endeavours. 
I do want to say that I hope to see more boarding conflicts on ships if possible, and maybe even asteroid/ground skirmishes of some kind. I would still recommend this game to peers, however, if they already had an interest in Space RTS games or RTS/FPS genre's.

The game is very beautiful none the less, much more eye catching than the first Executive Assault, though not as re-playable yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162174994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3466, 'last_played': 1710061148}
review:
I love this game it is the real meaning of the word or words RTS FPS; [real-time-strategy game, first-person-shooter]. 

The game is a bit buggy in some ares but it is getting a lot of updates and bug fixes, the content for the game is a bit lacking compered to the first game, but like I said they are always updating, adding content to the game as well as responding to comments regarding issues with the game or just adding new stuff.

To give a quick response, the game is great and anyone interested should definitely get the this game it's great and one of the best RTS, FPS games I have seen.
